Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Lâ€™Open Banking Ã¨ il nostro DNA!




Centrico ha le sue radici nelle rivoluzioni tecnologiche guidate dal gruppo Sella e dal 2019 Ã¨ una realtÃ  indipendente: creiamo innovazione per il mondo delle banche e della finanza con un sistema informativo aperto, veloce, modulabile e conveniente.




Il nostro obiettivo Ã¨ diventare una data driven company!

Per vincere questa sfida, la persona che cerchiamo farÃ  parte dellâ€™area Data Management di Centrico in qualitÃ  di Data Analyst e si occuperÃ  di analizzare i dati per fornire insights utili a supporto dei processi decisionali interni al Gruppo.




ResponsabilitÃ :

Analizzerai grandi quantitÃ  di dati per identificare trend, pattern e insights utili
Creerai report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati in modo chiaro e comprensibile
Collaborerai con team multidisciplinari (Business, IT, Compliance, Risk) per comprendere le esigenze di analisi dei dati e fornire soluzioni data-driven
Supporterai lâ€™individuazione di regole e di livelli di controllo dell'accesso ai dati
Contribuirai al miglioramento continuo della piattaforma dati del Gruppo tramite lâ€™implementazione di best practice e standard di settore




Requisiti:

Esperienza di almeno 4 anni nel medesimo ruolo o in ruolo affine
Laurea in discipline STEM
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati (es. SQL, Python, R)
Buona conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione dati (es. Power BI, Tableau)
Ottime capacitÃ  relazionali sia verso interlocutori tecnici sia di business
Spiccate capacitÃ  analitiche e di problem solving




Nice to have:

Esperienza con tecnologie di big data (es. Hadoop, Spark)
Conoscenza di tecniche di machine learning e data mining
Esperienza con strumenti di ETL (es. Talend, Informatica)
Certificazioni professionali in ambito data analysis (es. Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate)
Conoscenza di metodologie Agile e Scrum




Cosa offriamo:

Un ambiente positivo e in cui il tuo contributo venga apprezzato, la tua opinione Ã¨ importante e vogliamo che tu la esprima
Piattaforma e-learning Microsoft: per non smettere mai di imparare e di certificarti
AttivitÃ  di engagement (tornei di Beach Volley, Padel, Calcetto) e di volontariato aziendale
Contratto con CCNL del Credito
Cura della persona anche con la polizza sanitaria - per te e il tuo nucleo familiare - e polizza TCM
Supporto al benessere psicologico attraverso Stimulus, uno sportello esterno di ascolto a disposizione dei colleghi e dei loro famigliari
Uno sguardo al tuo futuro attraverso il contributo aziendale al fondo pensione
Policy di lavoro flessibile




Sede di lavoro: Milano o Torino o Biella con modalitÃ  ibrida.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Weâ€™re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

Weâ€™re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever theyâ€™re looking for in their local communities â€“ whether itâ€™s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What Youâ€™ll Do & Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subitoâ€™s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day


Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so itâ€™s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding


Skills Required


4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Highly proficient with SQL
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences


Plus


Good English proficiency level
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects


Benefits


Competitive compensation package
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
â€˜Work from anywhereâ€™ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more


For each working day, you will be eligible for a â‚¬8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you donâ€™t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they donâ€™t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Title: Industry Data Analyst Internship
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA)

Schedule

Full-time

Salary (Pay Basis)

1,286.09

Grade

INTERN

For more than 75 years, NATOâ€™s mission has been to preserve peace and security in the Alliancefor nearly one billion citizens. The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA) is NATOâ€™s technology and cyber hub. We are a team of 3000 civilian and military staff, working together to connect all corners of NATO and maintain its Edge from 30 locations across the Alliance.

We are a key partner in NATO's Digital Transformation, working hand in hand with industry to provide technical solutions and expertise, facilitating political consultations and decision-making, and enabling multi-domain operations.

Our experts provide secure static and deployable communications infrastructure, satellite communications and information technology services, connected the Allianceâ€™s forces, and strengthening NATOâ€™s defence and deterrence posture. Fulfilling NCIAâ€™s missions is possible because of our greatest force, our people. In order to reinforce NATOâ€™s edge, we aim to hire, train and retain the very best staff.

Our staff members represent both the diversity and unity of our Alliance. When you join NCIA, you will be part of an organization where you can contribute authentically to the mission and purpose of NATO and help us ensure seamless connectivity among Allied partner nations.

About The Program

The NCIA internship is a 6-month program based at one of our key hubs in The Netherlands, Belgium or Portugal. Our internship opportunities start from either 1 March or 1 September with the start date being dependent on the timeline to secure the required security clearance to work within the NATO community. During an internship, you will join and support a diverse international team and simultaneously learn from our experts via on-the-job training, working independently on purposeful projects or initiatives during your tenure.

About The Internship

Internship duration: 6 months

Location: Brussels, Belgium

The Office of the Chief of Acquisition (COA) provides the full range of acquisition expertise and activities that support the planning, implementation and maintenance of the required capability in support to the Agencyâ€™s strategic goals and missions. These functions include Contracting and Acquisition Lifecycle, which includes Integrated Product Support and Cost Estimating and Analysis. COA controls all NCI Agency procurement activities to ensure effective risk management and protects the legal and financial liabilities of the Agency by implementing the best practices to all acquisition activities, including Lifecycle Acquisition.

This internship position is with Industry Relations Team (IRT), under Acquisition Office.IRT is responsible for advising the Chief of Acquisition and the NCIA General Manager on all Industry Relations matters to include strengthening existing relationships with the private sector and not-for-profit organizations as well as building new ones, in direct support of the Agencyâ€™s Strategic Plan.

Internship Duties


Support the implementation of the Industry Strategic Engagement Plan (ISEP) through various tasks, primarily focusing on research, analysis and stakeholder engagement
Collect and analyse data from diverse sources (e.g., industry databases, surveys, open-source platforms) to support planning and reporting activities. Develop actionable, data-driven recommendations.
Present complex information in visually appealing formats tailored to different audiences and stakeholders.
Collaborate with internal cross-agency teams and external industry representatives to ensure alignment and effective communication.
Prepare reports, background documents, correspondence, and meeting minutes. Manage follow-ups on pending tasks to ensure timely execution.
Assist in planning and implementing industry engagement activities or visits in alignment with the ISEP.


About You

The valuable knowledge and experience that you bring to this role is:

Business Situation Analysis

Investigates straightforward business situations to identify and analyse problems and opportunities.Contributes to the recommendation of improvements.Follows agreed standards and techniques to investigate, analyse and document business situations.Engages with stakeholders under direction.

Knowledge Management

Maintains a knowledge management database.Leverages knowledge of a specialism to capture and classify content, taking expert advice when required.

Research

Within given research goals, assists in selection and review of credible and reliable resources.Searches for relevant material using specialised websites and sources, reads relevant articles to update knowledge of the relevant field.Reports on work carried out and may contribute sections of publication-quality material.Curates, under guidance, a personal collection of relevant material.

Eligibility Criteria

To be eligible to apply for our internship program, you will need to meet the following criteria:


You are a national of a NATO member country
You are currently studying towards a university-level degree or have recently graduated in the past 12 months
A thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable. Most of the work of the NCI Agency is conducted in the English language.


We also request that you please attach the following documents to your application form:


Copy of the university degree you have completed and/or
Proof of ongoing studies with the dates clearly mentioned if you are still studying


Application Process

The application process for an internship at NCIA is:

Ã˜ Apply via the NCIA Careers site by 23:59 CET 16 th March 2025

Ã˜ If selected to progress to the first stage evaluation this will consist of a logic, numeracy and behavioral gamification exercises in addition to on-demand video questions aligned to the requirements of the internship

Ã˜ Virtual interviews will take place in the month of April

Ã˜ Tentative offer to be presented to successful candidates in early May

Compensation

Belgium

You will be compensated at a fixed taxable rate of 1,286.09 EUR per month, based on 38 hours of work per week and for reasonable travel expenses to start on day 1 and to return to your home location once the internship is complete.

Thank you for your patience while we consider your application.To learn more about NCIA and our work, please visit our website .

NCIA prides itself on being an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment of mutual respect and value uniqueness and differences in gender, gender identity, race, ethnic or cultural origin, age, religion, sexual orientation and physical or neurocognitive ability.

Additional details on the conditions of application can be found via the NCIA career site.

COA controls all NCI Agency procurement activities to ensure effective risk management and protects the legal and financial liabilities of the Agency by implementing the best practices to all acquisition activities, including Lifecycle Acquisition.

This internship position is with Industry Relations Team (IRT), under Acquisition Office.IRT is responsible for advising the Chief of Acquisition and the NCIA General Manager on all Industry Relations matters to include strengthening existing relationships with the private sector and not-for-profit organizations as well as building new ones, in direct support of the Agencyâ€™s Strategic Plan.

Internship Duties

  • Support the implementation of the Industry Strategic Engagement Plan (ISEP) through various tasks, primarily focusing on research, analysis and stakeholder engagement
  • Collect and analyse data from diverse sources (e.g., industry databases, surveys, open-source platforms) to support planning and reporting activities. Develop actionable, data-driven recommendations.
  • Present complex information in visually appealing formats tailored to different audiences and stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with internal cross-agency teams and external industry representatives to ensure alignment and effective communication.
  • Prepare reports, background documents, correspondence, and meeting minutes. Manage follow-ups on pending tasks to ensure timely execution.
  • Assist in planning and implementing industry engagement activities or visits in alignment with the ISEP.

About You

The valuable knowledge and experience that you bring to this role is:

Business Situation Analysis

Investigates straightforward business situations to identify and analyse problems and opportunities.Contributes to the recommendation of improvements.Follows agreed standards and techniques to investigate, analyse and document business situations.Engages with stakeholders under direction.

Knowledge Management

Maintains a knowledge management database.Leverages knowledge of a specialism to capture and classify content, taking expert advice when required.

Research

Within given research goals, assists in selection and review of credible and reliable resources.Searches for relevant material using specialised websites and sources, reads relevant articles to update knowledge of the relevant field.Reports on work carried out and may contribute sections of publication-quality material.Curates, under guidance, a personal collection of relevant material.

Eligibility Criteria

To be eligible to apply for our internship program, you will need to meet the following criteria:

  • You are a national of a NATO member country
  • You are currently studying towards a university-level degree or have recently graduated in the past 12 months
  • A thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable. Most of the work of the NCI Agency is conducted in the English language.

We also request that you please attach the following documents to your application form:

  • Copy of the university degree you have completed and/or
  • Proof of ongoing studies with the dates clearly mentioned if you are still studying

Application Process

The application process for an internship at NCIA is:

Ã˜ Apply via the NCIA Careers site by 23:59 CET 16 th March 2025

Ã˜ If selected to progress to the first stage evaluation this will consist of a logic, numeracy and behavioral gamification exercises in addition to on-demand video questions aligned to the requirements of the internship

Ã˜ Virtual interviews will take place in the month of April

Ã˜ Tentative offer to be presented to successful candidates in early May

Compensation

Belgium

You will be compensated at a fixed taxable rate of 1,286.09 EUR per month, based on 38 hours of work per week and for reasonable travel expenses to start on day 1 and to return to your home location once the internship is complete.

Thank you for your patience while we consider your application.To learn more about NCIA and our work, please visit our website .

NCIA prides itself on being an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment of mutual respect and value uniqueness and differences in gender, gender identity, race, ethnic or cultural origin, age, religion, sexual orientation and physical or neurocognitive ability.

Additional details on the conditions of application can be found via the NCIA career site.

Title: CLIENT INSIGHTS DATA ANALYST
HTML:
About The Job

Within our Clienteling team, you will play a key role in transforming customer data into in-depth business analyses and strategic recommendations. Your main mission will be to detect opportunities for customer loyalty and engagement thanks to your mastery of data analysis and your sharp understanding of customer behavior.

Your Mission: Transform Data into Levers for Growth and Customer Loyalty

Job responsibilities

As a Client Insights Data Analyst, your mission will be to inform strategic decisions through your analytical expertise applied to customer data:

  • Conduct in-depth studies on the profile and behavior of our customers in both retail and e-retail.
  • Track customer trends and transform demographic, transactional, and engagement data into relevant insights and recommendations for business activations.
  • Measure commercial performance through precise KPIs and recommend areas for improvement.
  • Define and monitor precise KPIs to measure the performance of commercial actions and identify areas for improvement;
  • Contribute to the development of targeted Clienteling campaigns, monitor their implementation, and analyze their results;
  • Collaborate closely with business specialists from several departments to meet their needs for customer data analysis and optimize business opportunities;
  • Lead the network of regional correspondents in developing their customer knowledge: train them, provide them with simplified and automated reports, and support them in their ad hoc analyses;
  • Act as a proactive force for the Team Managers in developing the business and be a key contributor for sales, supporting teams on localized clienteling reporting and support with action plan, and regularly present your analyses and recommendations to the management teams;
  • Working together with Training team; leverage all the clienteling tools to engage and build long term Client relationships
  • Create and implement specific action plans to pro-actively drive the business
  • Reporting on client evolution and local clienteling KPIs on weekly/Monthly/quarterly basis for Front and DPCA teams;
  • Audience creation for EMEA wide and local activities for front and DPCA teams;
  • Clienteling Efficiency: collaborate with performance and experts' team to report accurate conversion for all clienteling campaigns
  • Managing Clienteling time with RTA based on the project and priorities;
  • Develop data visualizations that will allow monitoring performance;
  • Acting as Icons and Power BI project owner;
  • Coaching and training on tools-Icons device distribution and usage;
  • Streamlining internal requests processes and managing incoming Icons requests.

Profile

  • You have at least 3 years of similar experience;
  • Your analytical mind is your strength, combined with a sharp understanding of customer marketing;
  • Proven expertise in the daily use of SQL. Knowledge of Dataiku would be a plus;
  • Ability to present your analyses strategically orally and via PowerPoint;
  • You enjoy working in a team and being in direct contact with business teams. Interpersonal soft skills and ease in working daily with business contacts who are not data specialists;
  • Perfect command of English.

Reference LVM27257

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job title : Data Analyst

Job type : CDI Contracts / Freelancers

Location: Brussels

Work Regime: Hybrid

Keywords: Data analysis/Data Collection/Data Preparation/

Sector: our client is a leading company in the energy sector, renowned for its expertise in transmission and distribution networks. It plays a vital role in ensuring the reliability and efficiency of electricity supply across regions. With a commitment to innovation and sustainability, this company invests in cutting-edge technologies to optimize grid operations and integrate renewable energy sources.

Project Overview

This role involves establishing multi-energy scenarios through interactions with experts and public workshops, culminating in a public consultation. The Data Analyst will assist in creating scenarios, engaging with stakeholders, and performing various tasks within the SMA (Scenario, Market & Adequacy) team.




Key Skills

Energy Sector Knowledge: Understanding of the energy market and awareness of the latest developments and trends within Belgium and abroad.
Data Collection and Analysis: Ability to collect, understand, and prepare inputs for scenario creation.
Visualization: Proficiency in visualizing scenario assumptions and presenting them to stakeholders.
Documentation: Experience in preparing documents (Excel, Word) for public consultation and taking minutes during workshops.
Feedback Collection: Ability to collect feedback from experts and respond to comments during public consultations.
MS Office Proficiency: Good knowledge of MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
Graph Creation: Ability to create graphs that make complex data easy to understand.
Programming Knowledge: Knowledge of Python/R/economic dispatch tools/VBA/data handling is a plus.
Organization and Attention to Detail: Well-organized with strong attention to detail.
Proactive: Proactive attitude towards work.




Roles and Responsibilities

Scenario Creation: Assist in creating multi-energy scenarios through collaboration with experts and public workshops.
Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with stakeholders, including other transmission system operators (Fluxys, DSOâ€™s), and participate in the intensive stakeholder interaction process.
Data Collection and Preparation: Collect, understand, and prepare inputs for scenario creation, including NECP, latest trends, development plans of other major players, and decarbonization plans of the industry.
Visualization and Presentation: Visualize scenario assumptions and present them to stakeholders through workshops.
Documentation and Minutes: Prepare documents for public consultation and take minutes during workshops.




A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Americaâ€™s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards
International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our consulting client is looking for a Data Analyst to join the team in Brussels.




Experience in the Insurance industry is mandatory.




The candidate will analyse and interpret large volumes of data and evaluate results to provide insights that assist decision-making.




During system implementation projects, they conduct source-to-target data mapping activities by thoroughly examining entities, products, and processes to ensure coherent mapping.




Responsibilities:




Data Collection and Processing
Data Analysis
Data Visualization
Reporting and Presentation
Data-Driven Decision Making
Continuous Improvement and Learning




Your Skills:




We are looking for experience in SQL for data manipulation, strong technical and analytical skills, and programming knowledge (Python/R).
You must demonstrate clear and capable communication and presentation skills as a consultant.
Tableau/Power BI, matplotlib
BSc or an MSc in a relevant topic such as Maths, Computer Science or Statistics, etc..

Title: Data Analyst Young Graduate
Description:
What does this job entail?

The situation in a nutshell: we are already doing a lot with data and have some wonderful future plans for it. If you enjoy working on a creative puzzle with tables, youâ€™ll find KBC a satisfyingly challenging place to play.

Our team is a mix of enthusiastic starters and colleagues with extensive experience. They all enjoy working together and learning from each other. We treat our in-house experts to some of the most interesting technology around today.

As the data analyst in our team, you focus on functional analyses and functionally working out data solutions. You question: â€˜What do end-users need to see in a glance on this dashboard?â€™, â€˜How do we feed this AI model with the right data?â€™ and â€˜How do we pass good leads through to our sales colleagues to ensure they can proactively contact clients with relevant proposals?â€™

Itâ€™s a particularly enjoyable job in data, where smooth communication and collaboration are as important as your technical skills. You work together with data stewards, other data analysts, and your colleagues in Belgium and abroad who build up the data layer.

What do we expect from you?


You and your business colleagues discuss their data needs. By listening carefully and asking the right questions, you understand exactly what is needed to create added value.
You perform an analysis and fine-tune it with the business partner. You subsequently discuss this with the technical experts on your team to clarify the technical side. The result is an architectural and technical design of the data environment and the supporting frameworks and platforms.
You use your analysis as a foundation on which to set up functional test cases. In this way, you test whether the data solution does what itâ€™s supposed to.
You help with the implementation and maintenance of the technical set-up. You offer users your support for the set-up and maintenance of data.


Your key strengths?


You have a masterâ€™s degree in a relevant subject like ICT, engineering sciences or commercial engineering in management information systems.
Youâ€™re particularly interested in the tools, technologies and microservices within Big Data: Hadoop, Spark, Object Oriented Development, Python, scripting, Squid, JSON, Scala, Docker infrastructure, OpenShift, Kibana, Grafana and others â€¦
Youâ€™re motivated by the search for the information and insights hidden in data. Your curiosity and desire to learn are undeniable, but also infectious!
You enjoy working with colleagues from a variety of domains and make the most of their insights and expertise.
You communicate effectively and efficiently. You express your ideas in a clear, structured and convincing manner, both in Dutch and English.


What can we offer you?


Youâ€™re assured of an excellent onboarding and a pleasant, collegial work atmosphere.
Youâ€™re given plenty of room to (further) develop your skills. The world of tools and technology is evolving quickly, but you stay up to date thanks to training and education. A mentor guides you on your way.
Across your entire career at KBC, we encourage you to grow as a person and as a professional. You can follow training courses in which you further sharpen your hard and soft skills.
Our offices are easily accessible by public transport. Youâ€™re also welcome to partly work from home.
Flexible work hours help you to balance your work and your private life.
We offer you a permanent contract and a competitive salary, supplemented by extralegal benefits. Sounds familiar? Of course. Itâ€™s what you read in every job description. At KBC, we make a difference with our extended flex package. Itâ€™s too extensive to go into details here. However, we will happily discuss the various benefitsâ€”large and smallâ€”at your interview.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our data strategy and ensuring the successful implementation of our data initiatives. You will be responsible for analysing complex datasets, providing actionable insights and reports, and contributing to the development of our data platform. Your technical aptitude, curiosity, and autonomy will be essential as you collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.

As we embark on an exciting journey to create a robust data service, establish comprehensive data governance, and develop an innovative data platform!




Key Responsibilities

Analyse large datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends that support business objectives.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate data findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data engineers to design and implement data pipelines and ELT processes.
Participate in the creation and enhancement of our data platform, ensuring it meets the needs of various business units.
Provide technical expertise and support in data modelling, data integration, and data warehousing.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that drive business value.




About YOU

More than 3 years of significant experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a Startup or a software company.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R).
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, Power BI).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Curiosity and a passion for leveraging data to drive business outcomes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agencyâ€¦but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAMâ€™S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: â€¦ Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, â€¦
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, youâ€™re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Freelance Data Analyst (Financial Sector) â€“ Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)




Overview

We are looking for a highly skilled Freelance Data Analyst to support our financial data operations in Brussels on a hybrid basis. This is a 12-month contract with the potential for extension. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in financial data analysis, business intelligence, and reporting, helping drive data-driven decision-making within our organization.




Key Responsibilities

Analyze large financial datasets to identify trends, risks, and opportunities.
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and KPIs using Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Work with SQL databases to extract, clean, and transform financial data.
Support risk analysis, forecasting, and financial modeling to guide strategic decisions.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with financial regulations (e.g., IFRS, Basel III, MiFID II).
Collaborate with finance, risk, and compliance teams to provide insights.
Automate reporting processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual work.
Communicate findings to stakeholders through clear visualizations and presentations.




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or Looker).
Proficiency in Excel (Pivot Tables, Macros, VBA is a plus).
Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis (preferred but not mandatory).
Understanding of financial metrics, risk analysis, and forecasting techniques.

Soft Skills

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills to present insights to financial and non-financial stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with a strong focus on data accuracy.
Ability to work independently while collaborating with cross-functional teams.

Preferred Experience

Previous experience in the financial sector (banking, investment, insurance, fintech).
Familiarity with financial regulations (IFRS, Basel III, MiFID II).
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for data management is a plus.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid â€“ On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested in this position, feel free to apply with your CV or email it directly to adam@kodastaff.com

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.




Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collegaâ€™s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
Je hebt een analytische mindset.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.




Bonuspunten als je â€¦

Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.




Ons aanbod

We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carriÃ¨re verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, â€¦




Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About Brussels Airlines

Brussels Airlines, part of the Lufthansa Group, is the national airline of Belgium with its home base at Brussels Airport.

Our mission is to be the most reliable airline, making everyone feel at home.

We are passionate about what we do, whether itâ€™s on board, in an office, in the hangar or at an airport. Our people are recognized for always going above and beyond and for constantly challenging themselves.

Purpose of the position

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team, which is company-wide responsible to provide end-to-end data solutions, as well cooperate with Departmental Data Analysts on their Analytical roadmap. In your role you cooperate intensively with Data Engineers and Business Stakeholders from all areas (Commercial to Operations), and mainly focus on the original intake and analysis, as well final front-end part of the solution. The ability to think along with different stakeholders, together with being solution-oriented, are key assets within this role. You and the team aim to increase the level of Data Analytics in the different company areas to achieve a high impact on decision making, and therefore play a vital role in the future success of the company.

Your Tasks


Intake and Analysis: Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather, analyse, and document business requirements to translate them into final data solutions. Ensure that these requirements are aligned with business goals and technical capabilities.
Development of BI Reports: Design, develop, and maintain interactive reports and dashboards using Spotfire and Power BI. Customize reports to meet user needs and provide actionable insights.
Improvement and Innovation: Proactively evaluate current reports and processes, identifying opportunities for improvement. Recommend and implement new features, functionalities, and enhancements to make reports more actionable and user-friendly.
Provide Data Analytics & Insights: Leverage data analytics to generate meaningful insights for your business stakeholders. Transform raw data into actionable recommendations that help drive decision-making, identify trends, optimize business performance, and uncover new opportunities.
Data Validation: ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data used in reports and dashboards. Regularly perform data quality checks and resolve any discrepancies or errors identified.
Maintenance and Governance: Oversee the maintenance of Available reports and dashboards, ensuring data quality, consistency, and performance. Implement governance standards for data access, security, and reporting best practices.
Incident Management: Handle incidents related to BI reports and dashboards. Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve technical issues, ensuring minimal disruption to business users.
Documentation: Ensure that all BI solutions are well-documented for knowledge sharing and future reference.
BI Community Support: Provide ongoing support to the BI user community, including training, answering enquiries, and troubleshooting issues. Foster collaboration and knowledge sharing within and outside the team.
PMO Activities: Assist in project management activities for key business initiatives. Help track project progress, timelines, and deliverables, ensuring alignment with business priorities and goals.


Your profile


Master degree in Business, Computer or Data Science, or equivalent through experience in a data or analytical role.
3 years of relevant data experience, not in a user role, but in a supporting/development role.
Proficiency in BI tools, dashboard and report design (Spotfire, Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Programming skills (SQL, Python, Pyspark,...).
Datawarehouse understanding, in particular being able to exploit it to develop data solutions. A basic understanding of Azure DevOps and Databricks is seen as a plus.
Analytical mindset and ability to understand complex issues, as well the ability to come forward with clear manageable solutions.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Strong project management and organizational skills: able to organize a bigger project, or work on a bigger scope.
Action oriented with a positive and solution oriented attitude. Eye for sustainable solutions is key.
Team player and positive influencer with motivational skills.
Curiosity for business and data, along with an interest in emerging data technologies.
Experience with Agile methodology is considered a plus.
Very good English verbal and written skills.


What We Offer


A flexible reward plan that allows you to optimize part of your salary
A flexible work environment focused on activity-based working and home office possibility
Travel benefits
Company car (or car allowance and/or public transport subscription)
Profit sharing
Group insurance
Company medical plan (optional)
Representation & homeworking allowance
Meal & eco vouchers
A spot in a very enthusiastic team & a great company to work for

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Mission description:

We are looking for a support to help with several studies.




Therefore, we are looking for the support to assist the team in creating the scenarios and assisting in the stakeholder engagement process.

The consultant is required to have knowledge of the energy sector and to be aware of the latest developments and trends within Belgium and abroad.




The support will help to perform tasks in different streams within the SMA team:

Collecting, understanding and preparing inputs for the creation of scenarios (NECP, latest trends, development plans of other major players, decarbonization plans of industryâ€¦)
Co-creation of scenarios within expert groups
Visualization of scenario assumptions and presentation/alignment with stakeholders through workshops
Taking minutes during the workshops
Preparation of documents (Excel, Wordâ€¦) for public consultation
Collecting feedback of experts to answers comments on the public consultation

In parallel the consultant may be asked to work on other subjects in the department.




Service description:

Our client manages the Belgian high voltage network and its role is to transport electricity.

The purpose of the high voltage network is to transport the electricity supplied by electricity producers to distribution grid operators and large industrial users.




On top of the development of the grid, asset and system management and market facilitation above mentioned, the TSO in Belgium is also responsible to conduct several security of supply studies (short, medium and long term), vision studies, cost benefit analysis of future grid projects...




Additional requirements:

Degree in economics or engineering, or relevant experience in the energy sector.
You have knowledge of and interest in the energy market and are always up-to-date on the latest developments;
Well organised;
Attention to detail;
Pro-active;
Good knowledge of MS office (Excel, Word, Powerpoint) is a must
Ability to make graphs that make complex data easy to understand
Knowledge of Python/R/economic dispatch tools/VBA/data handling is a plus




Languages

Fluent in ENG. Knowledge of FR and/or NL are a plus.




Additional information:

Workregime: 5 days/week

Location: Empereur and homeworking

Startdate: when available

Enddate: 26/12/2025

Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.




Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions.Â

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)

over 20% growth each year

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title
Business Data Analyst

Job Description

Job title: Business Data Analyst
In this role you will ensure data consistency, quality, and utility across key domains. Also, you will collaborate with stakeholders, technical teams, and cross-functional experts to enhance analytics, support system improvements, and align Master Data Management (MDM) across processes and IT applications.

Your role:

Perform advanced analytics, data mapping, and reporting to support initiatives and projects.
Work on data quality initiatives
Support system and process improvements.
Develop deep expertise in key data domains and maintain a strong expert network.
Gather and document business, technical, and compliance requirements for Master Data Management consistency.
Deploy standards and guidelines to ensure process and system alignment across teams (Markets, BUs, Sales, Order Management, others).
Work with experts to gain a full end-to-end view of data processes, ensuring alignment with Business Data Stewards.
Ensure timely delivery and high-quality analysis and reports.
Engage with business stakeholders to understand challenges and translate them into analytics solutions.
Bridge technical teams and business stakeholders to align Master Data behavior.
Validate data lineage and contribute to building a data catalog.


You're the right fit if:

You have bachelorâ€™s or masterâ€™s degree in information management, computer/data science, or related field.
Experience with SAP or similar industry applications preferred.
Proficiency in one / two key data domain (Material, Customer, Installed Base, Pricing, others).
Knowledge of applications like Windchill, SFDC, SAP, Service Max, and similar.
Experience with analytics tools (Advanced Excel + Macros, Power BI, Qlik Sense, etc.).
3â€“5 years of experience in a similar-sized, complex, matrixed organization.
Experience in the medical or highly regulated industry is a plus.
Strong business acumen, including industry, sector, and process knowledge.
Strong business acumen and understanding of data flows and lineage.
Excellent communication and articulation skills to bridge technical and business perspectives.

Curious, resilient, and collaborative, able to work across global teams and time zones.

Job Title
Business Data Analyst

Job Description

Job title: Business Data Analyst
In this role you will ensure data consistency, quality, and utility across key domains. Also, you will collaborate with stakeholders, technical teams, and cross-functional experts to enhance analytics, support system improvements, and align Master Data Management (MDM) across processes and IT applications.

Your role:
  • Perform advanced analytics, data mapping, and reporting to support initiatives and projects.
  • Work on data quality initiatives
  • Support system and process improvements.
  • Develop deep expertise in key data domains and maintain a strong expert network.
  • Gather and document business, technical, and compliance requirements for Master Data Management consistency.
  • Deploy standards and guidelines to ensure process and system alignment across teams (Markets, BUs, Sales, Order Management, others).
  • Work with experts to gain a full end-to-end view of data processes, ensuring alignment with Business Data Stewards.
  • Ensure timely delivery and high-quality analysis and reports.
  • Engage with business stakeholders to understand challenges and translate them into analytics solutions.
  • Bridge technical teams and business stakeholders to align Master Data behavior.
  • Validate data lineage and contribute to building a data catalog.

You're the right fit if:
  • You have bachelorâ€™s or masterâ€™s degree in information management, computer/data science, or related field.
  • Experience with SAP or similar industry applications preferred.
  • Proficiency in one / two key data domain (Material, Customer, Installed Base, Pricing, others).
  • Knowledge of applications like Windchill, SFDC, SAP, Service Max, and similar.
  • Experience with analytics tools (Advanced Excel + Macros, Power BI, Qlik Sense, etc.).
  • 3â€“5 years of experience in a similar-sized, complex, matrixed organization.
  • Experience in the medical or highly regulated industry is a plus.
  • Strong business acumen, including industry, sector, and process knowledge.
  • Strong business acumen and understanding of data flows and lineage.
  • Excellent communication and articulation skills to bridge technical and business perspectives.
  • Independent, structured, and well-planned work approach with strong documentation and guiding capabilities.
  • Problem-solving mindset with experience in root cause analysis and lean principles.
  • Curious, resilient, and collaborative, able to work across global teams and time zones.
  • Experience working with global, multidisciplinary, and virtual teams.

About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.

Title: Data Analyst Consultant
HTML:
We are seeking an consultant to support a leading organization in the Belgian energy sector with key strategic studies, including the development of a multi-year policy plan for the electricity transmission grid.


In this role, you will collaborate closely with industry experts and stakeholders to develop multi-energy scenarios. You will also facilitate public workshops and coordinate efforts with other grid operators to ensure a comprehensive and forward-thinking approach.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Gather, analyze, and structure data for scenario development (policy plans, market trends, industrial decarbonization strategies, etc.);
  • Lead the co-creation of future energy scenarios with expert groups;
  • Develop visual representations and present scenario assumptions to stakeholders during workshops;
  • Prepare reports and supporting documents for public consultations;
  • Manage stakeholder feedback and respond to inquiries from industry experts;
  • Contribute to additional strategic projects within the organization as needed.


Your Profile:

  • Masterâ€™s degree in economics, engineering, or a related field within the energy sector;
  • Strong knowledge of the energy market and keen interest in industry developments;
  • Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail;
  • Proactive mindset with strong organizational skills;
  • Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint);
  • Experience with data visualization and analytical tools (Python, R, VBA) is an advantage;
  • Fluent in English; knowledge of French and/or Dutch is a plus.


What We Offer:

  • Full-time position (5 days per week);
  • Hybrid working model (office & remote);
  • Immediate start date.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.â€¯â€¯

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integrationâ€¯between enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis


Qualifications:


You hold a bachelorâ€™s or masterâ€™s degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hiveâ€¦
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.


We offer:


A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group


If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Department

The Corporate Planning division, located in Brussels, consists of several departments: The corporate planning department in charge of Group Controlling & Daikin Europe controlling, the Business Analytics department, and the Internal controls & J-Sox department.

The division is responsible for drilling down the strategy into annual budgets and realizing the group targets. This is done in cooperation with all sales and manufacturing entities, as well as with other departments in Daikin Europe. As a backbone for group-wide reporting, the department takes care of the management of the sales-, margin-, and pricing data, as well as collecting and reporting market intelligence. Our mission is to safeguard and manage profitability, via periodic reporting to top-management, close follow-up and by proposing countermeasure actions.

Furthermore, the division is responsible for the development and implementation of corporate governance and internal controls in the group (e.g. J-SOx and system access).

The vacancy is in the Business Analytics Department.

Function

The department is playing a leading role in the roll-out of actionable dashboards in sales, service and supply related departments and affiliates. You will write functional and business requirements to create the data models and develop PBI reports for these roll outs.
You are in close cooperation with business to understand their needs and requirements. You are able to look at these needs and requirements in the perspective of business and in the perspective of functional requirements.
You will be member of different project teams, who are involved in SAP/Azure projects at Headquarter and affiliates.
Together with our IT department you search what tools, functionalities and data the business needs to analyse and steer the business. At Daikin we aim to continuously improve and be at the forefront of new developments.
You'll be the driver behind the move towards more data driven business in EMEA.
You will promote the development of innovative new data and reporting platforms in collaboration with business and IT across all departments and Daikin Affiliates.




Your profile

You have a master degree in Business Economics, Finance, Accounting, Math or Data Science
You already have a 2-3 years of experience in a similar role as data analyst or business analyst, preferably in a complex and big organisation.
You have a strong understanding of ETL processes and can guide the IT department in structuring tables, relationships, and dimension mappings correctly. Basic knowledge of data warehousing (SAP BW, Microsoft Azure, Databricks) is a plus.
You are proficient in DAX, following best practices and handling complex statements such as calculation groups and parameter tables. Experience with Tabular Editor for centralized DAX management is preferred.
You develop Power BI dashboards and reports, transforming user input into proactive data visualizations that facilitate decision-making. You have experience optimizing report performance using tools like DAX Studio, Report Analyzer, DAX Optimizer, and ALM Toolkit (a plus).
You have a basic understanding of source systems such as SAP PR2 (S/4HANA), CRM, and CEC.
You have experience in building sales-related reports, including sales analysis, pipeline tracking, gross margin variation, SG&A tracking, and P&L analysis.
You are proactive and think outside the box to drive innovative solutions.
You have the ability to understand & challenge the needs of customers and to formalize the derived requirements
Outstanding collaboration, listening, written and verbal communication skills
You are result-driven with a strong focus on improvements




What we offer




At Daikin, you can count on a varied job with an international market leader that stimulates its people to grow and to work together. We offer you an open ended contract. You will be given extensive training and will be well supported from the start. The position carries a competitive salary and a package of extra-legal benefits. This function offers an excellent stepping stone to take on more responsibilities in a planning-oriented function or a detachment abroad at one of our EMEA affiliates.

Daikin Europe N.V.

Daikin Europe N.V. is the EMEA headquarters of the Japanese company, Daikin Industries Ltd. We design, manufacture and distribute air conditioning and heating systems for commercial, residential and industrial applications. Our headquarters are located in Brussels and Ostend, but through our sales networks we also have a presence throughout Europe, Africa and the Middle East.

We are the market leader in the field of air conditioning and also offer Total Comfort Solutions in the fields of cooling, heating, ventilation and related techniques.

In addition, as a company we are constantly expanding, with extensive international contacts, a pleasant, stimulating working environment, extensive training and coaching, ... Daikin Europe N.V. has many trump cards. However, our highly motivated employees are our greatest asset. That is why we are always looking for new talent.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Role; BI Analyst

Salary; Up-to â‚¬75,000

Location; Remote in the EU, Europe or Switzerland with occasional travel to Berlin




Brio Digital is supporting a Tech4Good organisation who are looking at developing their internal Data and BI team. We are looking for a skilled BI Analystwho has product management experience to join their team and help turn data into insights that drive strategic decisions.




If SQL, Power BI & Python are all something you can work on in your sleep, apply now!




The Role

As a BI Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing business data, developing reports and dashboards, and providing actionable insights to key stakeholders. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions. If you have experience in product management, thatâ€™s a big plus!




Responsibilities

Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data models using Power BI.
Write efficient SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
Use Python for advanced analytics, automation, or data processing tasks.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business objectives and deliver meaningful insights.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities to improve business performance.
Leverage product management experience to shape data-driven product decisions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reporting tools.




Requirements

Proven experience as a BI Analyst or in a similar role.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Python.
Ability to interpret complex data and communicate insights effectively.
Experience working with large datasets and data visualization best practices.
Experience in product management or working closely with product teams.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Title: Data Analyst - Quality Expert
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert

Unleash your data Quality enthusiasm!




Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.




So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst with focus on Quality at LACO, youâ€™ll be responsible for:




Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build (Power BI) data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS




You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You have an extended experience with Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage or Reporting Governance
You know all about the SQL
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modeling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.




You get even more bonus points if â€¦




You have a good Experience with master data management
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL
Other Security protocols like CLS (column Level Security, Object Level Security)
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER




Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement youâ€™ll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, â€¦




Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead
Description:
ðŸ“„ Type: Full-time | ðŸ“Š Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)




At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.




Your Mission:

Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.




What You Bring:

4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldnâ€™t be offered.




Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse dataâ€”we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgiumâ€™s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.




This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isnâ€™t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.




If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.




Full job description & application details here.




Ready to make an impact? Letâ€™s talk.

Title: Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst
Description:
About Ogilvy

Ogilvy has been creating impact for brands through iconic, culture-changing, value-driving ideas since the company was founded by David Ogilvy 75 years ago. It builds on that rich legacy through Borderless Creativity â€“ innovating at the intersections of its advertising, public relations, relationship design, consulting, and health capabilities with experts collaborating seamlessly across over 120 offices in nearly 90 countries. Ogilvy currently ranks as the #1 global agency network for creative excellence and effectiveness by WARC, signifying its ability toâ€¯deliver creative solutions that drive unreasonable impact for clients and communities.â€¯Ogilvy is a WPP company (NYSE: WPP). For more information, visitâ€¯Ogilvy.com, and follow us on LinkedIn,â€¯X,â€¯Instagram, and Facebook.

About Ogilvy Social.lab

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brusselsâ€™ WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices â€“ our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Unilever, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Lidl, Orange, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success locally & internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a "labâ€ mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Responsibilities


Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are â€˜sayingâ€™, â€˜sharingâ€™ and â€˜searchingâ€™ online.
Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
Work with our clients and present the intelligence work.
Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.


PROFILE


A first experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy
Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
A strong understanding of todayâ€™s social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channelsâ€™ codes.
A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
You understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.
Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
Reporting and visualization skills


OFFER


Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels â€“ the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency â€“ Our words and promises produce actions.
Attractive package and benefits
Strong flexibility plan
Continuous training opportunities
As an Ogilvy Social.Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training and career conversations while doing strong work that works.


At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.

We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities â€“ and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality.

Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.

Equal Opportunity Employer. Ogilvy considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants from the United States can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "Know Your Rights" and Pay Transparency posters by clicking here.

If you need any assistance seeking a job opportunity, or if you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at accommodations@ogilvy.com. Please note that this contact is only for candidates who are requesting accommodation. Emails for other purposes, including application status requests, will not receive a response.
