Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Reporting & Data Lead to join our dynamic team within the Insight-to-Impact department. In this role, you will focus on managing and streamlining data operations, reporting processes, and leading daily operations. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data management, project management, and cross-functional collaboration to drive high-quality, data-driven decision-making across the organization. A solid understanding of in-market data and its complexities, as well as experience using activity data in the pharmaceutical industry to generate actionable insights, is essential.




Key Responsibilities:




Data Management:

Manage and oversee go-to-market datasets, including activity data, in-market data, patient data, and market research.

Collaborate with teams across Commercial, Medical, and Market Access to ensure alignment and effectiveness.

Monitor data quality control processes to maintain accuracy and integrity.

Develop and enforce data management policies and best practices to standardize processes and ensure compliance.




Reporting Operations:

Oversee reporting processes to deliver actionable insights to key stakeholders.

Ensure timely and accurate report generation and dashboard development for business units.

Coordinate with country OE-leads.

Work with analytics teams to standardize reporting frameworks and key performance indicators (KPIs).




Project Management:

Lead and manage day-to-day data and reporting operations.

Optimize workflow for issue resolution and demand management.

Coordinate with IT, analytics, and business teams to align resources and ensure success.




Data Governance:

Establish and maintain data governance frameworks for compliance with regulatory and organizational requirements.

Define roles, responsibilities, and processes for managing data assets.

Promote a culture of data accountability and ethical data usage throughout the organization.




Qualifications:




Experience: Minimum 8 years of experience in data management, reporting, or related roles, preferably in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry. Proven experience in managing data projects and delivering measurable results.
Strong proficiency in business intelligence and data analysis.
Familiarity with pharmaceutical data landscapes and CRM data models from a technical perspective.
Hands-on experience with data management tools, reporting software, and databases (e.g., SQL, Snowflake, Power BI).
Excellent project management skills.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills to facilitate cross-functional collaboration.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to lead high-priority, business-critical initiatives within a matrix organization.
Fluent English proficiency is mandatory.

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions â€“ we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statisticsâ€¦) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agencyâ€¦but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAMâ€™S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: â€¦ Some passionate colleagues ðŸ˜€




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the clientâ€™s request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reportingâ€¦ could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: youâ€™re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Function

Advisory - Advisor

Roles & Responsibilities

At KPMG, we believe in harnessing the power of data to drive better business decisions. Our team of consultants works alongside clients to help them transform raw data into actionable insights that fuel strategic growth. As a global leader in audit, tax, and advisory services, we combine deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technologies to deliver innovative solutions.

Role Overview

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant, you will play a key role in helping our clients unlock the potential of their data. You will work on a variety of projects across different industries, focusing on improving decision-making processes, enhancing reporting capabilities, and developing data-driven strategies. You will collaborate closely with both internal teams and clients to ensure that data is collected, structured, and visualized in a way that drives value.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with clients to understand their data challenges and business objectives
Design and implement BI solutions, including dashboards and reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and optimize data models
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and insights
Provide recommendations to improve data management and reporting processes
Stay updated with the latest BI tools and technologies
Contribute to project management by ensuring timely and quality delivery


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications


Strong experience in data analysis, reporting, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) Proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights
Good communication skills to interact effectively with clients and teams
A passion for problem-solving and a detail-oriented approach
Team player with a collaborative mindset
Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
A good communication knowledge of Dutch & English


We offer


A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each otherâ€™s beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.

  • Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
  • Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
  • A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.

Title: Service Level Data Analyst
Description:
Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.

We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.

Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU, and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.

Who We Are Supporting

The NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.

The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:


Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.
Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.
Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.
Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.
Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.


Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.

The program

Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)

The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATOâ€™s principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.

To provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance-engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorise's: NATO International Civilians (NIC)'s, Military (Mil), and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)'s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.

Role Background

The NATO Information and Communication Agency (NCIA) located in Braine Lâ€™Alleud, Belgium, is currently involved in the development and support of new and existing capabilities for NATO. In light of these activities, the NATO Digital Workplace Centre (NDWC), within the framework of its mandate is adapting innovative and secure communications solutions for NATO staff across the Enterprise. In order to improve the service delivered, NDWC is looking for a Business Data Analyst to monitor

service performance, and to assist the Management in establishing and preserving clear definition for Service measures and metric. These tasks are all geared toward the realization of NDWCâ€™s 2030 objectives. Specifically, the Lines of Efforts are the following:


Design reports to help Chiefs, Service Area Owner (SAO) and Service Delivery Managers (SDMs) understand operational behavior and consolidated service performance and trends
Work with other business areas to integrate datasets, enabling automation in report generation and enhancing data analysis
Provide daily reports for operational activities, weekly reports on SLA trends, incidents, and ticket distribution, and rolling monthly and quarterly reports with comprehensive performance metrics.
Create dashboards that align with agency standards, offering a high-level view of service metrics for decision-makers


Role Duties And Responsibilities


Design, generate and present Service Level Management reports
Work independently to gather data from different domains and propose improvement to drive data integration and automation
Support the Higher Management and the SAOs/SDMs in collecting requirements and designing dedicated statistical view over the data
Support Monthly and Quarterly meetings with Chiefs/SAOs/SDMs


Deliverables:


A requirements analysis document, outlining all necessary specifications for the Operational Dashboard
Design and present mockup of the reports to implement in the Operational dashboard
Implement the approved reports in the Operational dashboard


Essential Skills And Experience

To evaluate the qualifications and experience for this this contract, please provide evidence of successfully delivering three distinct Data Analysis and Performance projects within the last five years. Each evidence should demonstrate proof of performance and be comparable in size and scope to the requirements of this role. Evidence should showcase the ability to manage data and reports, as well the ability to use Business Intelligence tools like Power BI and dashboards delivered with Microsoft Excel.

Working Location


Braine lâ€™Alleud, Belgium


Working Policy


On-Site


Travel


Some travel to other NATO sites may be required


Security Clearance


Valid National or NATO Secret personal security clearance


We never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?




Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the â€˜Data analytics expertise centreâ€™




WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?




The â€˜Data analytics expertise centreâ€™ occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.




WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?




You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.




WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?




A Masterâ€™s degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline); a doctorate is an asset.
Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.




WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?




A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Flexible working hours.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Opportunities for internal mobility.
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.




Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Title: Internship - Data Science
Description:
Introduction

Technopolis is offering a 5-6 months paid internship at our Brussels office.

About This Job

We seek to appoint an enthusiastic intern to gain first-hand insights in applying data science techniques for policy analysis. It is an exciting time to join the growing data science work at Technopolis Group, where we are deploying new tools across our practice to enhance our policy analysis capacity, from generative AI to reproduceable analytical pipelines. You will mainly focus on developing cross-cutting tools and techniques that can be applied across the company, as well as contribute to specific projects.

Your profile

Applicants Suitable For This Position Should Have


Recently finalised university education (master) or a student currently in the last year of a Master programme, preferably in data science, applied statistics, or related fields. Priority will be given to applicants that combine data science with economics or public policy, either in your studies or in past professional experience.
Experience of programming languages for data manipulation, especially Python, R and SQL.
Some knowledge of modern data science tools and concepts such as git, Github, Visual Studio, environment variables.
Experience and interest in data science techniques such as generative AI and other machine learning techniques.
Interest in widening your skillset beyond data science: we develop fully-rounded analysts who are also capable of applying data science techniques â€“ not just programmers.
Interest in European Commission policies, in particular in science, technology and innovation;
Excellent communication skills in English;
Ability to work independently and as part of a team;
Willingness to learn about new topics, methods, and skills.


The Following Will Be Considered As a Plus


Proficiency in other languages.


Your Responsibilities

Typical tasks may include:


Developing data analysis pipelines;
Applying supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to mainly text data;
Data wrangling;
Data visualisation;
Reporting results of analysis;
Assist in other tasks such as literature reviews, case studies and other tasks where needed.


Our offer

Skills

The successful candidate will work as a paid intern in our Brussels office. The role provides the opportunity to gain experience in working at the forefront of European policymaking, to develop analytical skills, and to experience a multinational, friendly business environment. Our package includes:


Paid internship
Belgian phone subscription
Monthly allowance for the transportation card
Training and mentoring possibilities
Working in an international company with 12 offices and more than 290 colleagues


Interested? Apply directly

Applicants need to have either EU citizenship or a valid work permit.

For any questions on the recruitment, please contact recruitment_be@technopolis-group.com (reference DSU_INT2025).

Only the short-listed candidates will be contacted.

About Us

Technopolis Group started as a consultancy firm for the evaluation of science, technology and innovation. While evaluation is still at the core of our company, we have over the years built up the know-how to support decision making on a broad range of topics. Our experts provide strategy and foresight, manage networks and provide project management support for even the most complex projects. We are acquainted with a wide range of quantitative methods and deliver advanced data analytics that is ahead of the curve. We evaluate policies, evaluate their impact and communicate them effectively to experts and the broader public. We never settle for out-of-the-box solutions but work with our clients to find the approach that best fits their needs.

We work with decision-makers in different levels and fields, from international institutions, such as the European Commission and multilateral development banks, to regional and local authorities. Our clients include universities and R&D centres, network organisations such as business associations, clusters and incubators as well as governments.

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
How do you help make a difference? As a Data Analyst, you are responsible for collecting, analysing and interpreting data to generate valuable insights.




What is your role?




As an HR Data Analyst, your main responsibilities are:




â€¢ You act as an expert on HR data for other teams within the organization. In this role, you will represent HR in the various data governance bodies.

â€¢ You ensure the accuracy and quality of the data.

â€¢ You identify opportunities for improvement of processes and applications through data analysis.

â€¢ You ensure the logical structuring of data in function of processes and reporting needs. Why is this new challenge something for you?




You have the following competencies:




â€¢ You have knowledge of how data is organized and used in SAP HR and/or Success Factors.

â€¢ You know how to logically structure and define data assets.

â€¢ You are analytical and critical and you know how to get things done!

â€¢ You are an inquisitive team player.

â€¢ You work independently towards the desired result and take predetermined deadlines into account.

â€¢ You have good communication skills and you are able to present complex data in understandable language.




You can also express yourself very well in Dutch, French and English.




Where will you work?




You will work in the HR Program Office. The team consists of about 20 colleagues in various positions (business analyst, data analyst, process analyst, program manager) and has its headquarters in Brussels, near Brussels-Midi.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Senior Business Data Analyst

Employment: Freelance/Contract

Location: Fully Remote




I am searching for a Senior Business Data Analyst for leading bank in the Netherlands. This role goes beyond requirements gathering as it involves data modelling, big data analysis, and close collaboration with developers to refine data models, design controls, and improve entity resolution.




Day to day requirements:




Data exploration and big analysis to refine data models.
Analyse scoring and entity resolution outputs to improve monitoring solutions.
Define requirements in Jira, ensuring clarity for development teams.




Key requirements:




Extensive experience with Quantexa (Certification is a bonus)
Previous experience as a IT Analyst or business facing Data Analyst
Experience defining controls logic for monitoring solutions.
Strong data modelling skills (ETL, UI etc)
Experience in querying and analysing big data (Scala experience is a bonus)
Experience in Transaction Monitoring domain.
Strong knowledge in Capital Markets or Trade Finance.




To be successful in this position you must have previous experience with Quantexa. Please apply for further details.

Title: Sales Data Analyst (m/f/*)
Description:
The Impact Youâ€™ll Make in this Role

As a Business Analyst (m/f/*), you will be part of the Consumer Business Group, responsible for the commercialization of worldwide leading brands including ScotchÂ®, Scotch Blueâ„¢, Commandâ„¢, Scotch-Briteâ„¢, Post-itÂ®, 3M, Futuroâ„¢, Nexcareâ„¢, among others and you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.

Here, you will make an impact by:

Determining Advanced Analysis and Insight Generation: Leveraging retailers and distributors' point of sales (POS) data, syndicated data, and shopper data to generate actionable insights.
Driving POS Growth and Mitigating Declines: Utilize your analytical expertise to develop strategies that enhance POS growth, while identifying and addressing potential declines through effective category management.
Playing a pivotal role in executing category management strategies. This involves deep dives into category performance, identifying growth opportunities, optimizing product assortment, and providing guidance on pricing and promotional strategies.
Influencing Partnership with Key Accounts: Build and maintain strong relationships with retailer/distributor key accounts within EMEA, influencing decision-making through data-driven insights and category management expertise.
Collaborating with all business analysts to implement Consumer Business Group global analytic strategies and tactics, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.




Your Skills and Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:

Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree or higher from an accredited institution preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
Expert Experience in business analytics or a related relevant customer market with a preference for experience in the FMCG industry.
Category Management demonstrated expertise and data-driven decision making.
Language Proficiency: Fluent in French AND English is a must
Communication Skills: Excellent storytelling and presentation skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in presenting to clients.




Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:

Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and data interpretation skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Power BI.
Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with planogramming software (e.g., JDA Space Planner), and an understanding of data modeling techniques.
Leadership Qualities: Proven leadership skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders and drive implementation of strategic initiatives.




Supporting Your Well-being

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life â€“ both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.




Resources for You

For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers. If you have further questions please reach out to Max (our AI Virtual Assistant) via our Career Page.




*At 3M, diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability. If you want to discover more about D&I at 3M, please visit http://go.3M.com/4i9C

Title: Data Analyst - Data & AI
Description:
Ben je gepassioneerd door data & analyse en krijg jij energie van het bouwen van Power BI dashboards met oog voor design die relevante informatie helder voorstellen? Werk je bovendien graag mee aan de meest innovatieve data oplossingen van de toekomst? Dan is een rol als Power BI Data Analyst binnen ons Data & AI team misschien interessant voor jou!


In je rol als Power BI Data Analyst werk je nauw samen met ervaren collegaâ€™s aan Business Intelligence, Big Data en AI-projecten. Deze projecten worden voornamelijk in de Microsoft Cloud uitgevoerd.
Aan de hand van je analytisch inzicht help je mee aan de transformatie van ruwe data tot inzichtelijke informatie door gebruiksvriendelijke Power BI dashboards te ontwikkelen.
Je analyseert de noden van de klant en vormt de brug tussen business users en data engineers.
Je voorziet de klant van nieuwe inzichten door eenvoudig te begrijpen data visualisaties uit te werken.
Je bent een krak in het geven van demo's aan onze klanten.
Innovatie en kennisdeling staan bij ons hoog op de agenda. We zijn altijd op zoek naar vernieuwing en verbetering bij onze klanten. Je krijgt volop kansen om hierin actief deel te nemen.
Je komt terecht in een hecht, gedreven en gepassioneerd team waarin het aangenaam en leuk werken is. We hebben zelfs een eigen Data & AI funteam.


Wat breng jij mee?


Je behaalde een bachelor of master, bij voorkeur op het gebied van (Bedrijfskundige) Informatica of Business IT & Management of een hieraan gerelateerde studierichting.
Je hebt enkele jaren ervaring opgebouwd als Data Analyst en Power BI kent voor jou geen geheimen meer.
Je hebt een aanstekelijk enthousiasme over data & business intelligence.
Kennis omtrent het Microsoft Azure Data Analytics Cloud platform is een pluspunt.
Je hebt (of wenst) een Microsoft Certified Professional certificaat.
Kennis van technologie in data engineering en datawarehouses is een plus. Ook kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python is een meerwaarde.
Je bouwt impactvolle dashboards als geen ander Ã©n je haalt energie uit storytelling.
Je brengt een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale houding met je mee.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden (zowel in het Nederlands als in het Engels), klantgerichtheid en nauwkeurigheid zijn tevens zeer belangrijk in deze rol.
Een bepaalde flexibiliteit naar verplaatsingen is vereist aangezien er af en toe van bij de klant wordt gewerkt. Als je aanwezigheid bij de klant niet vereist is dan kan je in het Cegeka-kantoor dichtst bij je woonplaats werken (Antwerpen, Diegem, Gent, Hasselt of Leuven) of vanuit je home office!


Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?


We vragen heel wat (talenten) van jou. Gelukkig krijg je er ook heel wat voor terug! Competenties en karakter zijn voor ons essentieel, naast ervaring en ambities. Cegeka investeert voortdurend in talent management opdat elke medewerker zijn potentieel kan realiseren.
Je start bij een Top Employer!
Een marktconform loon aangevuld met extralegale voordelen. Een elektrische wagen met laadpas of een mobiliteitsbudget, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques, een interessante groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering, een gsm-abonnement, een forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding, een krachtige laptop en de mogelijkheid om je salarispakket een eigen accent te geven dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan.
Flexibele werkuren Ã©n eenâ€¯mooie work/life balans.
Een top team: waarin nieuwe frisse ideeÃ«n en initiatieven steeds welkom zijn! Team-events, happy hours en een steeds legendarisch bedrijfsfeest horen daar ook bij.
Begeleiding op maat: doorheen jouw carriÃ¨re word je begeleid door onze people managers. Zo heb je een aanspreekpunt, een persoonlijke coach Ã©n een sparringpartner.
Continu bijleren: door innovation centers, leesgroepen, knowledge sharing meetings, hackatons, deelname aan conferenties en externe opleidingen zetten we kennisdeling en bijleren centraal.
Mogelijkheid tot groei: afhankelijk van je eigen interesses en initiatieven, biedt Cegeka verschillende horizontale en verticale carriÃ¨repaden.
Hybride werken: je werkt vanuit eenâ€¯Cegeka kantoor in jouw buurt (Hasselt, Leuven, Diegem, Antwerpen, Gent), gecombineerd met on site aanwezigheid bij de klant en thuiswerk.
We hechten waarde aan duurzaamheid door CO2-neutraliteit na te streven met de elektrificatie van ons wagenpark en een milieuvriendelijk datacenter. We ontwikkelen innovatieve oplossingen met een positieve impact op milieu, mens en maatschappij, en streven naar een inclusieve en diverse werkomgeving waarin iedereen gewaardeerd en gehoord wordt.


Aspire to more: onze belofte aan jou

Je krijgt bij Cegeka alle ruimte om jezelf als professional verder te ontwikkelen. Samen realiseren we wat je Ã©cht wil betekenen voor onze klanten en collegaâ€™s. We nodigen je graag uit om met ons mee te groeien. In een ongekende veelzijdigheid aan uitdagende, betekenisvolle IT-projecten. Zet je stempel op projecten voor aansprekende klanten waarbij we het verschil maken. Aspire to more.

Intensief, met veel plezier en betrokkenheid. We werken hier altijd met elkaar samen, in close cooperation met collegaâ€™s Ã©n met de klant. Binnen een cultuur, gedreven door onze waarden: eigenaarschap, persoonlijke ontwikkeling, respect en authenticiteit. Kom deel uitmaken van de volgende fase van een succesvol, snelgroeiend en innovatief internationaal IT-bedrijf.

Title: Analyste de donnÃ©es
Description:
SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.




SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis




Qualifications:

You hold a masterâ€™s degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hiveâ€¦
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.




We offer:

A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group




If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium. Let's Tech Together!

Title: Data-analist
Description:
ORGANISATIE




Onze klant, Randstad Group, is een toonaangevende HR-dienstverlener die wereldwijd actief is. Met een sterke focus op innovatie en datagedreven oplossingen, speelt Randstad een sleutelrol in het vormgeven van de toekomst van werk. In BelgiÃ« is de organisatie een gevestigde waarde met een uitgebreid netwerk en tal van ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden voor hun medewerkers.

Randstad staat voor een inclusieve cultuur waarin samenwerken en het stimuleren van groei centraal staan. Momenteel zoeken zij versterking in de rol van Data-Driven IT Project Manager om hun digitale transformatie verder vorm te geven.




FUNCTIE

In deze veelzijdige rol combineer je projectmanagement met data-analyse om datastrategieÃ«n te ontwikkelen en implementeren. Je staat in voor het coÃ¶rdineren van data-projecten en werkt nauw samen met interne en externe stakeholders om oplossingen op maat te realiseren.




Als IT Projectleider:

Je bepaalt de scope, doelstellingen, tijdslijnen en deliverables van projecten.
Je beheert budgetten/resources en coÃ¶rdineert met interne en externe teams.
Je anticipeert op risicoâ€™s, lost problemen op en bewaakt de kwaliteit van deliverables.
Je garandeert de naleving van richtlijnen inzake architectuur, beveiliging en privacy.

Als Analist Data:

Je werkt samen met business stakeholders om noden en uitdagingen in kaart te brengen.
Je vertaalt business requirements naar concrete oplossingen en zorgt ervoor dat business en IT gealigneerd zijn.
Je faciliteert workshops en overlegmomenten om de juiste beslissingen te nemen.
Je valideert of de opgeleverde producten voldoen aan de vooropgestelde verwachtingen en richtlijnen.
Je aligneert met de globale datastrategieÃ«n binnen Randstad Group.




PROFIEL

Master- of bachelordiploma met ervaring in grote(re) (dienstverlenende) ondernemingen of internationale groepen.
Ervaring met data principes en het opzetten van projecten of begeleiden van analyses.
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels.
Vermogen om relaties op te bouwen en te onderhouden, zowel lokaal als internationaal.
Pragmatische aanpak met focus op resultaten.







AANBOD

Het aanbod omvat een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, bonussysteem, bedrijfswagen, flexibiliteit op vlak van werkplek en meer. Daarnaast krijg je ook de mogelijkheid om tot 3 dagen van thuis te werken.

Heb jij de juiste ervaring en motivatie om deze uitdagende rol aan te gaan? Solliciteer dan nu op florence.carlier@atrecruitment.be

Title: Reporting & BI - Product & Market, AS Performance
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for a Reporting & BI - Product & Market, AS Performance to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Marketing Knowledge & Data Analytics Manager.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Reporting & insights, trend visualization, AI modelling, performance analysis
Responsible for the preparation, extrapolation and analysis of product and market
Analyze product / aftersales performance based on specific reports (price position, trends, competitors' actions)
Frequent reporting of campaign performance
Media KPIs (GRP, reach, impressions, clicks, CPC)
Number of qualified visitors, cost per QVs
Showroom traffic
Captive bank data analysis based on request
Supervise and monitor quarterly and seasonal campaigns & action plans, execution of European Aftersales marketing strategies and programs, webpage development
Review AS campaign data and evaluate the results of the performed campaign, lead strategic direction for future campaigns
Ensure sufficient training (internal) for reporting
Control budget related to the dealer data and systems
Managing special projects and ad-hoc reporting and analysis for regional and national management


What we look for:


Minimum 5 years professional experience preferably within the automotive industry, EV experience is a plus
Experience within an international, matrix organization is highly advantageous
Experience in Data management / engineering
Higher education at Bachelors' level
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage
Analytical skills
Advanced PC skills
Experienced MS Office user, especially in Excel
Presentation skills
Data-driven decision-making
Borderless and virtual mindset
Ability to simplify
Familiarity with data Management principles and practices
Experience creating and documenting policies and procedures
Ability to work with both business stakeholders and technical support teams to resolve data issues
Ability to communicate successfully with stakeholders at all levels to understand their needs and translate those needs
Ability to communicate with highly technical individuals about the desires, insights, and observations of the business and to ensure development and deployment of appropriate solutions


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Solver - Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist
Description:
About ExsolvÃ¦:

ExsolvÃ¦ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and AI.




At ExsolvÃ¦, our "Solvers" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.




We are seeking a Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist to join our expert team and help our clients unlock the power of data to drive strategic decision-making and innovation.




Your Role:

As a Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics Specialist, you will design and implement data-driven solutions that enable organizations to make informed, strategic decisions. You will work alongside multidisciplinary teams, using advanced BI tools and techniques to create insightful dashboards, reports, and analytics workflows.




What Weâ€™re Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications

Educational Background: Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, and strong SQL skills for querying databases.
Data Integration Skills: Experience with ETL/ELT processes and tools such as Azure Data Factory, SSIS, or Informatica.
Cloud Experience: Hands-on experience with cloud BI platforms like Azure Synapse Analytics, AWS QuickSight, or Google BigQuery.
Programming Skills: Familiarity with Python or R for advanced analytics and statistical modeling.
Soft Skills: Strong analytical thinking, communication, and collaboration skills to work with clients and multidisciplinary teams.




Preferred Skills

Knowledge of big data tools like Apache Spark or Hadoop.
Experience with predictive analytics and machine learning integration into BI workflows.
Familiarity with KPI frameworks and business acumen to align analytics with strategic goals.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or Tableau Certified Professional.




What Youâ€™ll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to assess their analytical needs and recommend BI solutions that align with their strategic goals.
Data Integration and Reporting: Design and implement data visualization solutions using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, creating impactful dashboards and reports.
Data Ecosystem Implementation: Build and optimize scalable data pipelines to process and transform data efficiently for BI and analytics purposes.




Technical Implementation

Data Modeling: Develop and maintain robust, scalable data models to support analytical needs.
ETL/ELT Development: Create efficient data integration workflows using ETL/ELT tools and frameworks.
Advanced Analytics: Apply statistical and predictive modeling techniques to extract actionable insights from complex datasets.
Cloud BI Solutions: Deploy and manage BI workflows on platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud to ensure performance and scalability.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on advancements in BI and analytics technologies, tools, and methodologies.
Explore innovative ways to integrate advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive analytics and machine learning, into BI solutions.




Project Management

Lead BI and analytics projects from concept to completion, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver end-to-end solutions that meet client objectives.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams with BI and analytics capabilities.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the reliability and scalability of deployed solutions.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Contribute to diverse BI and analytics projects across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Access the latest BI and analytics tools and training opportunities to stay at the cutting edge.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values knowledge sharing and mutual growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.




If you are a driven professional with a passion for Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics, and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful data-driven solutions, weâ€™d love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions â€“ we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statisticsâ€¦) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Reporting & BI - Product & Market, AS Performance
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for a Reporting & BI - Product & Market, AS Performance to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Marketing Knowledge & Data Analytics Manager.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Reporting & insights, trend visualization, AI modelling, performance analysis
Responsible for the preparation, extrapolation and analysis of product and market
Analyze product / aftersales performance based on specific reports (price position, trends, competitors' actions)
Frequent reporting of campaign performance
Media KPIs (GRP, reach, impressions, clicks, CPC)
Number of qualified visitors, cost per QVs
Showroom traffic
Captive bank data analysis based on request
Supervise and monitor quarterly and seasonal campaigns & action plans, execution of European Aftersales marketing strategies and programs, webpage development
Review AS campaign data and evaluate the results of the performed campaign, lead strategic direction for future campaigns
Ensure sufficient training (internal) for reporting
Control budget related to the dealer data and systems
Managing special projects and ad-hoc reporting and analysis for regional and national management


What we look for:


Minimum 5 years professional experience preferably within the automotive industry, EV experience is a plus
Experience within an international, matrix organization is highly advantageous
Experience in Data management / engineering
Higher education at Bachelors' level
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage
Analytical skills
Advanced PC skills
Experienced MS Office user, especially in Excel
Presentation skills
Data-driven decision-making
Borderless and virtual mindset
Ability to simplify
Familiarity with data Management principles and practices
Experience creating and documenting policies and procedures
Ability to work with both business stakeholders and technical support teams to resolve data issues
Ability to communicate successfully with stakeholders at all levels to understand their needs and translate those needs
Ability to communicate with highly technical individuals about the desires, insights, and observations of the business and to ensure development and deployment of appropriate solutions


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Digital Analyst - Brussels
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about challenges? Izertis is your company.

We are looking for a Digital AnalystÂ for a client in Brussels.




Responsibilities:

You will be a key player in digital optimisation and apply your analytical expertise. You will cooperate with a team of digital experts (technical, development, analysts, UX, etc.) and have various responsibilities, including:

Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlationsÂ 
Develop and maintain complex data models using SAS and SQLÂ 
Create data visualizations and reports using Tableau to communicate insights to stakeholdersÂ 
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and develop solutions to meet their needsÂ 
Develop and maintain databases, data warehouses, and data martsÂ 
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrityÂ 
Develop and implement data governance policies and proceduresÂ 
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualizationÂ 

Â 

Requirements:
At least 3 years of relevant experience
Fluency in English
Proficiency in SAS programming language (Base SAS, SAS/STAT, SAS/GRAPH)Â (mandatory)
Strong knowledge in SQLÂ Â 
Experience with data visualization tools, specifically TableauÂ 
Experience with data quality and data governance
Experience in Marketing Digital (is a plus)
You have the ability to think analytically and logically and are able to develop a holistic, yet detailed approach.
You are able to clearly communicate technical analyses to a business audience.
You are meticulous and highly organized in your work.
Customer oriented and immune to stress
Creative and solution oriented
Proactive and flexible
Easy communicator and excellent collaboration with internal clients
Team spirit
Multi-tasking
Ensures high quality deliverables (attention to detail is crucial)

Â 

Check if you have the DNA we are looking for at: https://www.izertis.com/pt/adn-izertis

Apply and present us your challenges and professional goals!

Title: BI Analyst(SAN417)
Description:
Job Description


A Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst is responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data to support decision-making within an organization.
The BI Analyst works with various business units to identify opportunities for improvement, provides insights through data analysis, and develops reporting tools to help business leaders make data-driven decisions.
The role involves gathering, analyzing, and presenting data to inform strategic decisions that drive business performance. Responsibilities:
Collect, process, and analyze business data to uncover trends, insights, and performance metrics.
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations to provide real-time business insights.
Work closely with business leaders and departments to understand data needs and provide actionable insights.
Design, develop, and optimize data models for effective business analysis and decision-making.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across various sources and systems. Technical Skills:
Power BI
Tableau
SQL
ETL
VLOOKUP
Excel
Python
AWS


Hiring Team Member

Avula Srivalli

Recruitment Coordinator


LinkedIn
Mail

  • The role involves gathering, analyzing, and presenting data to inform strategic decisions that drive business performance. Responsibilities:
  • Collect, process, and analyze business data to uncover trends, insights, and performance metrics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?




Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the â€˜Data analytics expertise centreâ€™




WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?




The â€˜Data analytics expertise centreâ€™ occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.




WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?




You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.




WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?




A Masterâ€™s degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline); a doctorate is an asset.
Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.




WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?




A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Flexible working hours.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Opportunities for internal mobility.
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.




Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Title: Data Analyst - ETL Development
Description:
Job Description: Data Analyst Engineer (ETL Developer)

Purpose: Translate and analyze business requirements, design & update data models with both functional and technical intake within the Data Warehouse project as a primary focus.

Responsibilities:

Align features with projects, teams, and applications.
Create a functional analysis that enables the development team to implement user stories.
Analyze existing systems and highlight areas for improvement.
Create procedures and packages to meet the ETL requirements, including testing.
Conduct performance analysis to optimize the impact on operational systems.
Contribute to master data management projects and provide feedback on data flows.
Engage in the Data Team for sharing knowledge & work in close collaboration with the architects.

Requirements:

Hard Skills:

Higher education degree with at least 5 years of experience in business and/or functional analysis and as an ETL Developer.
Expertise in collecting, analyzing, and documenting business and functional requirements.
Experience working in large and complex projects with many stakeholders.
Profound knowledge of T-SQL scripting & querying.
Knowledge of the MS SQL stack (DB - SSIS - SSRS) on 2019 and 2022 releases, Standard Edition.
Knowledge of Azure and Databricks.
Experience in implementing solutions with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) & its ETL capabilities.
Strong experience in Data warehousing (DataVault, ...)
Knowledgeable about data modeling, data access, and data storage techniques.
Big data (Hadoop, ...), pipeline orchestration, log collection & distribution tools are a plus.
Finance & Risk knowledge (mainly in reporting area, ex Solvency II, BGAAP, IFRS4/9/17).
Experience in Agile or SCRUM practices is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch/English or French/English.

Soft Skills:

Analytical mind, well-organized, and result-driven.
Focus on details.
Sense of initiative and a real team player.
Ability to follow up on development and link development to requirements.
Ability to work together with PM to construct a roadmap to deliver required BI systems according to requirements.
Ability to work in various fields and keep up to date with technological developments in the market.
Working knowledge of data and process modeling, data access, and data storage techniques.
Great communication skills.
Organizational and presentation skills.
Interpersonal and teamwork skills.

Additional Skills for All Levels:

Intellectual/Analytical Ability: Develops estimating and planning skills, is well-organized, and can manage time effectively.
Sense of Reality: Accepts responsibility for dedicated work packages and strives for on-time delivery.
Innovation/Initiative: Escalates issues or problems early, takes necessary actions to get things done or moving, and demonstrates a proactive attitude.

  • Knowledge of the MS SQL stack (DB - SSIS - SSRS) on 2019 and 2022 releases, Standard Edition.

  • Experience in implementing solutions with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) & its ETL capabilities.
  • Strong experience in Data warehousing (DataVault, ...)
  • Knowledgeable about data modeling, data access, and data storage techniques.
  • Big data (Hadoop, ...), pipeline orchestration, log collection & distribution tools are a plus.
  • Finance & Risk knowledge (mainly in reporting area, ex Solvency II, BGAAP, IFRS4/9/17).
  • Experience in Agile or SCRUM practices is a plus.
  • Fluent in Dutch/English or French/English.

Soft Skills:

  • Analytical mind, well-organized, and result-driven.
  • Focus on details.
  • Sense of initiative and a real team player.
  • Ability to follow up on development and link development to requirements.
  • Ability to work together with PM to construct a roadmap to deliver required BI systems according to requirements.
  • Ability to work in various fields and keep up to date with technological developments in the market.
  • Working knowledge of data and process modeling, data access, and data storage techniques.
  • Great communication skills.
  • Organizational and presentation skills.
  • Interpersonal and teamwork skills.

Additional Skills for All Levels:

  • Intellectual/Analytical Ability: Develops estimating and planning skills, is well-organized, and can manage time effectively.
  • Sense of Reality: Accepts responsibility for dedicated work packages and strives for on-time delivery.
  • Innovation/Initiative: Escalates issues or problems early, takes necessary actions to get things done or moving, and demonstrates a proactive attitude.

Title: Senior Financial Data Analyst
Description:
Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic, and labelling is accurate.



Eurofins is dedicated to delivering testing services that contribute to the health and safety of society and the planet, and to its corporate responsibility to protect the environment and ensure diversity, equity, and inclusion across the entire network of Eurofins companies.





Job Description



The Senior Financial Data Analyst will lead comprehensive benchmarking initiatives across Eurofins' clinical operations in Europe, with occasional scope extending internationally if required by the business. This role involves driving cross-country benchmarking exercises, ensuring accurate and harmonized data collection, and analyzing total cost of ownership (TCO) to identify pricing disparities and cost-saving opportunities.



Working closely with country lab representatives and experts, business leaders, and category managers, the specialist will will assess consumables pricing and other costs while considering broader factors such as service levels, quality, lead times, supplier performance, and labour costs. Findings will translate into clear, actionable recommendations that support strategic decision-making and subsequent sourcing initiatives.



The successful candidate will combine strong analytical capabilities with exceptional stakeholder management skills within a project management framework, driving the collection of results by ensuring timely data gathering, alignment, and execution of benchmarking initiatives across countries and business units. The role requires in-person presence at the Brussels office, with potential travel to address more complex issues when needed.



Key Responsibilities



1. Benchmarking and Data Collection



Lead 2-3 benchmarking projects simultaneously, balancing workload based on project complexity.
Engage directly with country business lines, laboratories, biologists, and subject matter experts to gather clinical sourcing data and test information from local systems.
Ensure speedy data collection across countries while guaranteeing the information is harmonized, accurate, and complete.
Evaluate pricing by category and sub-category, considering total cost of ownership, including labour impact and regulatory specifics.

2. Analysis and Insight Generation



Analyze benchmarking data efficiently, identifying key insights and opportunities for cost optimization.
Apply judgment to prioritize significant cost drivers while deprioritizing non-material costs.
Conduct TCO assessments, including comments from stakeholders regarding broader factors such as service levels, quality, lead times, and supplier performance.
Present findings in a clear, concise, and actionable format for stakeholders.

3. Stakeholder Engagement and Project Management



Act as the project manager for benchmarking initiatives, ensuring timely progress and stakeholder alignment.
Organize and lead meetings with country business lines, providing clear context and expectations.
Follow up persistently to "chase" missing data and ensure project completion.
Prepare materials and insights for senior steering committees (steercos), including the Regional Business Line CFO, Clinical Business Leaders, and the Head of Global Purchasing.

4. Strategic Recommendations and Follow-Up



Collaborate with category managers and business leaders to develop recommendations based on benchmarking findings.
Support the creation of timelines for follow-up projects to capture identified value.
Ensure insights are integrated into sourcing strategies and category plans.
Stay informed of ongoing RFPs to incorporate fresh benchmarking data into decision-making.


Qualifications



Core Skills:



Strong analytical skills, with advanced proficiency in Excel.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and the capacity to simplify complex matters and provide options to various challenges (by country cost of operating, subject to various regulatory, etc ... ).
Effective stakeholder management and interpersonal skills, with a strong emphasis on teamwork and collaboration.
Ability to balance numbers with people, navigate resistance to desired change and calibrate time contingencies.
Ability to collect, structure, and analyze data while ensuring accuracy and harmonization.
Clear and concise communication, with the ability to present findings to senior leadership.
Sense of urgency, get things done on time.

Preferred Tools and Systems:



Experience with Power BI and Coupa is a plus.
Familiarity with LIMS systems is beneficial but not required.

Education and Experience:



Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Finance, Business, or a related field.
5â€“7 years of experience in purchasing, sourcing, supply chain management, or financial analysis/benchmarking.
Demonstrated success in leading cross-functional projects and benchmarking initiatives.
Experience working across multiple countries and stakeholder groups.
Language : English (must have), and second language of the following: French, German and Spanish.


Additional Information



We support your development! Do you feel you donâ€™t match 100% of the requirements? Donâ€™t hesitate to apply anyway! Eurofins companies are committed to supporting your career development.



We embrace diversity! Eurofins network of companies believe in strength and innovation through diversity, being an Equal Opportunity Employer. We prohibit discrimination against employees or applications based on gender identity and/or expression, race, nationality, age, religion, sexual orientation, disability, and everything else that makes employees of Eurofins companies unique.



Sustainability matters to us! We are well on our way to achieving our objective of carbon neutrality by 2025, through a combination of emission reduction and compensation initiatives. We encourage our laboratory leaders to make sustainable changes at their local level, and in addition to their initiatives we also count on our dedicated carbon reduction team to help us to achieve this goal!



Find out more in our career page: https://careers.eurofins.com/



Company description: Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate.



The Eurofins network of companies is the global leader in food, environment, pharmaceutical and cosmetic product testing and in discovery pharmacology, forensics, advanced material sciences and agroscience contract research services. It is one of the market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies, as well as having an emerging global presence in Contract Development and Manufacturing Organisations. It also has a rapidly developing presence in highly specialised and molecular clinical diagnostic testing and in-vitro diagnostic products.



In over 35 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to 63,000 staff across a decentralised and entrepreneurial network of ca. 950 laboratories in 60 countries. Eurofins companies offer a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products.



In 2022, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR 6.7 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.

Title: Senior Data Analyst Consultant
Description:
Tasks

Lead and deliver complex client assignments, ensuring quality assurance and guiding consultants in their daily tasks
Assist clients in addressing their most pressing data and regulatory challenges, including credit, risk, finance, client, and ESG regulations
Analyze data to derive valuable insights and take ownership of implementing solutions while measuring their effectiveness in partnership with the client
Build and nurture strong client relationships, including training junior consultants and engaging with senior client management
Facilitate post-delivery meetings to assess project value and performance, ensuring continual client satisfaction
Lead proposal processes end-to-end and ensure successful project completion
Support Senior Managers and contribute to the development of practice value propositions and directors during key meetings




Benefits

Dynamic and challenging environment to start your career in Financial Services
Opportunity to work on a wide range of complex and rewarding projects for prestigious clients within the banking industry
We promote internal knowledge sharing, a dedicated Risk and Regulatory Academy, external courses and professional certification programs (e.g., FRM, PRM)
We invest in the development and progression of our people to maximise their potential
We are a non-hierarchical organisation and promote openness, teamwork and knowledge sharing within the firm and the Reply Group
We offer a competitive base salary alongside a benefits package including bonuses to reward performance




Qualificationsâ€‹

At least 3 years of professional experience working as a Data Analyst
Masters Degree or equivalent in Finance, Economics, Business Management, Business Engineering or other relevant field of studies
Fluent in English as well as able to speak either Dutch or French
You have advanced proficiency in SQL and/or Python
You possess solid expertise in data manipulation, analysis, cleansing, extraction, transformation, loading, and visualization techniques
You have experience working with data tools such as Collibra, Mega Hopex, MicroStrategy, Dataiku, Qlik, Power BI, and Tableau
You have an interest in AI and a strong understanding of data-related concepts such as data quality, metadata, and Master Data Management







About Avantage Reply

Avantage Reply, part of the Reply Group, specialises in Financial Services consulting with a focus on Governance, Risk and Finance Transformation, Treasury and Capital, Quantitative Modelling, Compliance and Regulatory Advisory. With offices across Europe, we count some of the worldâ€™s most significant financial groups among our clients, including in Investment, Retail and Commercial Banking, Custodian Banking, Insurance and Investment Management.
