Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Junior Data Engineer at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving data engineering, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Junior Data Engineer at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
I am currently working with a Data Solutions Provider who are seeking an experienced Talend Data Engineer to join their team. They are looking for a Dutch Speaking candidate who has experience using Talend, Qlik and other modern technologies.




Your role would be to:

Utilize Talend to integrate and process data from diverse sources.
Work closely with teams and clients to generate valuable data insights.
Develop and enhance ETL workflows for efficiency and scalability.




You would need:

2-5 years of practical experience in Talend Data Integration.
Fleuency in Dutch.
Proficient in SQL with a deep understanding of data warehousing.
Familiarity with Azure, Qlik or Snowflake is a plus!

If you are interested in a position like this, then send your CV to alex.wetton@g2recruitment.com




Best regards,

Alex.

Title: Onderzoeker en data-analist
Description:
Werken bij CM, is werken met goesting. Want bij CM heb je een positieve impact op het leven van miljoenen Belgen. Dat ervaren onze duizenden medewerkers elke dag. Samen dragen we bij aan een gezondere samenleving voor iedereen. Dat geeft voldoening en energie.

Ook voor jou is CM een fijne en zorgzame werkomgeving, waar je ideeÃ«n uitwisselt en jezelf ontwikkelt. Waar je kan rekenen op je collegaâ€™s en je verbonden bent met elkaar. Plezier hebben in wat je doet, daar doen we het voor!

Bij CM telt elke dag. Voor de mensen, de samenleving en voor jezelf.




De studiedienst volgt de evolutie van de gezondheidstoestand van de bevolking op en analyseert het socialezekerheidsstelsel. Binnen CM draagt ze bij aan de ontwikkeling van een langetermijnvisie op het gebied van gezondheid en (maatschappelijk) welzijn. De Studiedienst is verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren van de evoluties in de gezondheidszorg door middel van verkennende studies en ad-hoc analyses.




Dit zoeken we




Jouw opdrachten als onderzoeker en data-analist :

â€¢ Je volgt themaâ€™s op gerelateerd aan de economische aspecten van de gezondheidszorg en kan de vragen van de organisatie hierover beantwoorden.

â€¢ Je bent in staat om gegevensextracties te doen en kwantitatief onderzoek uit te voeren op basis van deze gegevens.

â€¢ Je voert budgettaire en economische gezondheidsgerelateerde analyses uit.

â€¢ Je draagt bij aan de kennisopbouw van CM op het gebied van gezondheid.

â€¢ Je werkt mee aan de onderzoeksprojecten van CM, in functie van de noden.

â€¢ Je analyseert je onderzoeksresultaten kritisch en synthetiseert ze in een wetenschappelijk rapport. Je formuleert ook concrete aanbevelingen voor de directie.

â€¢ Je deelt de resultaten van de studies op overtuigende wijze mee aan de verschillende doelgroepen (beleidsmakers, zorgverleners, burgers, enz.).

â€¢ Je werkt je kennis en vaardigheden bij en werkt mee aan de ontwikkeling van de onderzoeksprocessen van CM.




Dit ben jij




â€¢ Je hebt minimum een masterdiploma. Ervaring op het gebied van economie, volksgezondheid, gezondheidsbeleid, sociologie of statistiek is een troef.

â€¢ Je beschikt over relevante werkervaring inzake kwantitatief onderzoek.

â€¢ Je beschikt over relevante werkervaring inzake economische of budgettaire analyses, bij voorkeur in het domein van gezondheid.

â€¢ Een kennis van de wetgeving op het vlak van gegevensbeheer is een troef.

â€¢ Je bent in staat om gegevens te analyseren: kennis van SAS of python is een troef.

â€¢ Je bent bereid om je kennis over de invaliditeits- en ziektekostenverzekering en over de verschillende aspecten van het gezondheidsbeleid te verdiepen.

â€¢ Je bent een dynamische collega die ideeÃ«n aanbrengt en zich inzet voor de projecten van de dienst. Je hecht veel belang aan de resultaten van teamwerk.

â€¢ Je bent ervan overtuigd dat solidariteit en universele toegang tot zorg belangrijke waarden zijn van het gezondheidsstelsel van ons land.

â€¢ Je bent in staat om zelfstandig te werken en initiatief te nemen.

â€¢ Je kan analytisch en kritisch denken.

â€¢ Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van het Nederlands of het Frans, en je hebt een goed begrip van de andere taal.

â€¢ Je hebt minimum een passieve kennis van het Engels.




Dit bieden we je




â€¢ Maatschappelijke impact: Bij CM werk je niet zomaar. Samen met je collegaâ€™s draag je rechtstreeks of onrechtstreeks je steentje bij aan de gezondheid van velen. Je werk heeft echt betekenis.

â€¢ Opleidingen en Groeimogelijkheden: Bij CM sta je zelf aan het stuur van je loopbaan. Je krijgt kansen om te groeien in je functie en in de organisatie. Er zijn veel opleidingen om je kennis en vaardigheden te vergroten.

â€¢ Aantrekkelijk loonpakket: Je krijgt een vast contract en een mooi pakket aan voordelen. We bieden een bruto maandloon afhankelijk van jouw relevante ervaring. Maar er is meer: maaltijdcheques (8 euro), 13e maand, een extra premie in juli, netto-onkostenvergoeding, fietsvergoeding, aanvullende kinderbijslag, groepsverzekering, hospitalisatieverzekering, verzekering gewaarborgd inkomen, fietslease, â€¦

â€¢ Flexibel werken: Je werkt voltijds in een 38 urenweek met flexibele werkuren en je kan een vrij dagdeel opnemen. Je krijgt 20 verlofdagen, 4 extra feestdagen, 12 ADV-dagen en extra verlof naarmate je langer bij ons werkt. Je standplaats is Schaarbeek. Daarnaast is er ruimte voor thuiswerk.

Show more

Title: Stagiaire Data Analyst
HTML:
As we are revamping our BI solutions, we need someone to help us catalog existing dashboards/reports and continuously improve them. The Data Analyst Intern will assist the Business Intelligence team in creating data visualizations and interactive reports for Chanel in the Swiss Markets. This role offers a chance to learn, grow, and contribute to meaningful projects in a dynamic work environment.


  • Conduct an assessment of existing BI solutions, rationalize or harmonize them if necessary.
  • Collaborate with business teams to understand visualization requirements and needs.
  • Assist in the design and the development of Power BI dashboards and reports.
  • Participate in the maintenance and improvement of existing BI solutions.
  • Contribute to the resolution of issues relative to data quality and data consistency across the different sources and global/regional BI solutions
  • Contribute to special projects and continuous improvement initiatives.


Job Profile


  • Student in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field;
  • Basic knowledge of BI tools, particularly Power BI;
  • Knowledge of SQL language is a plus;
  • Strong interest in the field of Business Intelligence and data analysis;
  • Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively;
  • Proactive and eager to learn and contribute to the team;
  • Proficiency in English and French.


From July 2025;

Based in Geneva

Duration: 6 months

Title: Data and Reporting Analyst
HTML:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.

With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.


â€œRethink Everythingâ€ is our philosophy â€“ it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.


Data and Reporting Analyst (Geneva, Switzerland)


We report on the evolution of LOIMâ€™s Financials (Assets under Management, Revenues and Costs) to various internal and external stakeholders. We manage LOIMâ€™s revenue processes and implement LOIMâ€™s transfer pricing policies. We provide Financial Planning and Analysis to LOIMâ€™s business lines and to the Lombard Odier Group.


YOUR ROLE


  • Develop, maintain and run workflows that prepare data and ensure data quality for facts and dimensions feeding our dashboards and reports;
  • Collaborate with our internal data providers (IT, Operations, Business Dev) in projects, production and troubleshooting;
  • Produce, maintain and upgrade dashboards, reports and ad-hoc analysis intended for Senior Management, Investment teams, Business Development;
  • Participate to the preparation of Revenue forecasts;
  • Drive various projects, e.g. improvement of existing data management processes, design dashboards that address new business requirements, integrate new data sources;


YOUR PROFILE


  • 3-5 years of experience in a similar role;
  • Experience working with large datasets and building reports for various stakeholders
  • Strong technical skills, including experience with Alteryx and Tableau, Microsoft office (Excel/Access, VBA), Cognos ReportNet a plus;
  • Genuine interest for the financial industry and investment products;
  • Technically minded and detail oriented with strong conceptual and problem solving skills;
  • Organized, ability to progress on multiple concurrent tasks with autonomy;
  • Team player with good communication skills;
  • Very good written and spoken English and French;
  • Residence in Switzerland.


Our Maisonâ€™s DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.

As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maisonâ€™s DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.


It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.

Title: Data Analyst/ML Engineer Intern
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Your internship

Join one of the teams building brand new systems with GenAI tools at its core. Drive the strategy for data intelligence by finding insights and grounding product decisions in the real world data. Solve real world problems with agentic AI systems, run large scale evaluations using LLMs and pave the way for the future of Digital Employee Experience. This internship offers a unique opportunity to work at the forefront of AI innovation, equipping you with the skills to make a real-world impact.

What You Will Do


Innovate with Latest Technologies: Conduct research, data analysis and LLM experiments leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies, commercial and open source.
Collaborate with Experts: Work closely with AI/ML researchers and software engineers using data insights to help developing and optimizing the state-of-the-art AI applications.
Contribute to Development: Actively participate in evaluation, integration, and deployment of your solution in the nexthink platform.
Communicate Your Insights: Present your findings and recommendations to the team and key stakeholders.


Qualifications


MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, ML or a relevant field
You love working with data and finding patterns and insights.
You are creative and happy to offer new ideas and solutions.
You have a good understanding of LLM technologies, Python data science libraries, SQL.
You are not afraid of software engineering tools: git, docker, AWS.
You have a drive for analytical problems and you like solving challenges, have a good team spirit and are happy to collaborate with the team.
You should also have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Professional level of written and spoken English skills are a must.


Additional Information

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

ðŸ“ Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.

ðŸ¡ Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

ðŸ¤¸ Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

ðŸ‰ Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

ðŸ¤ Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Data Analyst Tableau (F/H)

Title: Data Analyst, Worldwide Operations
Description:
Description

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.

This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen and exceptional written and oral communication skills. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of different business models and the underlying analytics, and the ability to assimilate new methodologies and data sources. They will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, be vocally self-critical, and with an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. They recognize that the true measure of the work product is the business impact it has.

In this role, you will work closely with the operations teams to provide data and analytical support for Sort Center initiatives, root cause investigation of defects, and will provide support to insure compliance to operational-related SOX requirements. Moreover, analyze data to support Operational Excellence initiatives, dig deep into data to determine root cause of defects, build and maintain decision support tools, and present findings to business partners to drive improvements in Fulfillment Center-wide quality and productivity.

The complexity of research and skills for the position is well beyond basic data entry and research. It involves complex analysis and diving deep into key metrics based on requests, building and maintaining multiple databases, extensive knowledge of software applications to create tools, and understanding of multiple programming languages. The following provides some detail of the job duties and responsibilities.

Key job responsibilities


Development of data collection processes and data management systems
Maintenance of data integrity (0% error rate)
Designing of queries, compiling of data, and generation of reports in MS Access and Excel
Charting and graphing of data for reporting purposes
In depth research of defect trends
Data collection and entry as needed
Data mining and problem solving


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree or equivalent
1+ years of data analysis and formula creation in Microsoft Excel experience
1+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role and conducting analysis and data mining using Excel
1+ yearsâ€™ experience extracting and processing data using SQL.
Demonstrated experience pulling and analyzing data to aid in root cause identification and drive process improvement initiatives across the network


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with end-to-end project management


Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region youâ€™re applying in isnâ€™t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Servicios Comerciales Amazon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Job ID: A2818556

Title: Product Data Analyst (Internship)
Description:
At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.





Job Description



We are looking for a Product Data Analyst Intern to join our team and gain hands-on experience in data analytics. This is an exciting opportunity to develop analytical skills, work with real-world data, and contribute to improving the travelerâ€™s journey. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and eager to learn how data drives business decisions, keep on reading!



The candidate will have the opportunity to become an integral part of the team, learning how to extract and analyze data to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to support the optimization of post-sales processes and assist in cross domain projects.



The job in brief:



Job Title - Product Data Analyst Intern



Working model - Chiasso hybrid



Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.



Level - Internship



Location - Chiasso



Contract - Internship - full-time (EUR 36 h/week)



Duration: 12 months



Travel time required - No



What your impact will be



Assist with data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
Learn how to communicate and present results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge
Closely partner with Data Engineers to identify data needs and support the data quality of the deliverables


Qualifications



Your expertise:



- Currently pursuing or recently completed a STEM degree



- Knowledge of SQL and Excel.



- Familiarity with data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.



- Proficiency in English.



Desirable:



- Python



- Interest in digital, ecommerce business and travel industry



- Experience in building pipelines and data models





Additional Information



Perks of working with us:



How we work together:



- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (youâ€™ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)



- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations



How we learn together:



- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.



- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as Oâ€™reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.



Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes



- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues



- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares



- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)



Wish you were here? We do, too!



Selection process steps*:



- HR interview (10-30 minutes)



- Offline Tech test



- 1st interview (Manager): Test review



- 2nd interview (Manager + team member):



- Offer extended
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)



Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging



At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.



Eligibility criteria:
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.

Title: Business & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Ralph Lauren Corporation (NYSE:RL) is a global leader in the design, marketing and distribution of premium lifestyle products in five categories: apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. For more than 50 years, Ralph Lauren's reputation and distinctive image have been consistently developed across an expanding number of products, brands and international markets. The Company's brand names, which include Ralph Lauren, Ralph Lauren Collection, Ralph Lauren Purple Label, Polo Ralph Lauren, Double RL, Lauren Ralph Lauren, Polo Ralph Lauren Children, Chaps, among others, constitute one of the world's most widely recognized families of consumer brands.

At Ralph Lauren, we unite and inspire the communities within our company as well as those in which we serve by amplifying voices and perspectives to create a culture of belonging, ensuring inclusion, and fairness for all. We foster a culture of inclusion through: Talent, Education & Communication, Employee Groups and Celebration.

Provide cross functional analysis and design powerful visualizations to support our stakeholders in making strategic decisions.

Develop standards and tools to enhance automation of reports and connections to/from them.

Design, Create, Implement, And Maintain Reporting And Tools By


Coordinating with other data analyst/data scientist/IT teams to lead common projects and drive best practice solutions that are aligned company wide
Collecting, monitoring, and analyzing data to identify areas of improvements, risks, and business changes
Maintaining databases and tools, and performing updates as necessary to ensure accuracy
Developing new tools to continuously improve process efficiency and integrate new business requirements
Collecting cross-functional analysis & reporting needs, department tools and opportunities for standardization and automation of processes.
Designing, producing, enhancing reports, dashboards and tools for the Integrated Business Planning function including Inventory Management
Helping to drive critical business decisions by analyzing metrics and designing reports
Providing suggestions based on findings that might be utilized to inform business strategies
Providing an on-going presence â€˜on the groundâ€™ to help end users leverage the tools and available training
Being the first â€œline of supportâ€ when an issue arises


Basic Qualifications

Experience, Skills & Knowledge


Education level: Bachelorâ€™s degree or higher in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, or a related discipline
Strong technical and analytical skills. Aptitude for problem solving and for turning data inputs into relevant information
High degree of computer literacy, especially MS Excel and VBA
Strong SQL and SAP BI skills are highly desirable
Power Query, DataIku, MS Azure, MS Access, Python would be a strong plus


What Is Required For This Position


Efficient time management, priority setting, and capacity to meet deadlines
Attention to detail and accuracy, curiosity, and a mindset of continuous learning and improvement
Passionate team player with ability to take ownership and accountability for tasks
Fluent in reading, speaking, and writing in English, with French a strong plus

Title: Intern in Data Analysis within Process Development (100%)
Description:
Get to know Climeworks

Climeworks removes COâ‚‚ from the air to fight global warming and protect future generations to come. We develop, build and operate direct air capture (DAC) machines which capture COâ‚‚ directly from the air. The captured carbon dioxide is removed from the air by safely storing it underground, permanently. Founded in 2009 by engineers, Christoph Gebald and Jan Wurzbacher, Climeworks was built with a mission to inspire 1 billion people to remove COâ‚‚ from the air, and is now spearheading the DAC industry globally. It has the worldâ€™s largest DAC facility and storage installation in operation and a team of over 300 Climeworkers determined to contribute to a net-zero future. A true climate pioneer, Climeworks is featured as a TIME100 Influential Company 2022 and Global Cleantech 100 Company 2022, driving a revolutionary technology engineered to solve the most pressing issue of our time. We foster a dynamic environment and are building a global purpose driven team. We are looking for disruptive thinkers, passionate achievers and inspiring leaders that are ready to take on the worldâ€™s greatest challenge.

Will you join us?

Your Mission
Job description


Your mission at Climeworks is to actively support the Process Development team in various tasks related to testing facilities, operational plants and future projects.
You will develop tools and data visualizations to support analysis of the performance of testing facilities and operational plants.
You will participate in field tests at operational plants and develop tools to aggregate the collected data and use it to improve our modelling capabilities.
You will support the definition and documentation of KPIs for testing and operational facilities.
You will contribute to setting up deviation detection and alerting systems for testing facilities and operational plants.


Your Story
Job requirements


You have a bachelorâ€™s or masterâ€™s degree in computer science, engineering, or related fields.
You are eager to learn new concepts, skills, and tools that you might need to complete your assignments.
You are reliable, performance-driven, and maintain a structured working style.
You thrive in both fast-paced team environments and when working independently.
You are fluent in English; German skills would be an advantage.
You have experience with Python and SQL, additional MATLAB skills would be an advantage.
You are available for a full-time 6-month internship, ideally starting in March/April 2025.


What we offer: A horizontal organization, a great team, an improvement-oriented approach, and a scale-up venture with an innovative technology. Sounds like you? We are looking forward meeting you! Apply now by filling in the online application form and uploading your complete dossier to our careers portal: Careers at Climeworks

Our promise: At Climeworks, you are accepted for who you are.

As part of our ongoing journey towards creating a diverse and inclusive environment - we encourage everyone to apply! All qualified applicants are considered for positions, so bring along your knowledge, personal experiences, and fresh perspectives, and together we can solve one of humankindâ€™s greatest challenges. We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: Internship - Data analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Work Your Magic with us!

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know youâ€™ve got big plans â€“ so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich peopleâ€™s lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.

United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.

Start date: April 2025

Duration: 6 months

Location: Aubonne, Switzerland

Your Role


Collect and analyze data for various products or services offered by the company.
Contribute to creating performance reports and dashboards using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or AERA
Support the business to creating dashboard that allow the identification of trends, patterns, or anomalies that might indicate issues or opportunities for improvement.
Resolve technical and functional issues on existing dashboards.
Interact cross-functionally and capture user requirements and business needs to provide dashboards and increase efficiency for various internal stakeholders.
Participate in team meetings, workshops, and training sessions to develop skills and knowledge.
Provide training and help end-users learn how to use the dashboards.


Your Profil


Currently pursuing a masterâ€™s degree in business administration, computer science or related field and willing to learn about the healthcare industry
Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, AERA and Knowledge in SQL database and experience with cloud platforms are strong pluses.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and passion for innovation, business development, and entrepreneurship and strong work ethic, self-starter, and team player
Fluent English communication, both written and spoken, with additional language skills like French are considered advantageous


What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of our diverse team!

Title: Data & Analytics Specialist at NestlÃ© Switzerland
Description:
Position Snapshot

Location : La Tour-de-Peilz, Switzerland

Company: NestlÃ© Suisse S.A.

Act. Rate: Full-Time / Part-Time Act. Rate 80-100%; Open to Job sharing

Type of contact: Permanent contract

Deadline for applications: 20th March 2025

Attractive Additional Benefits

Genuine opportunities for career and personal development

Modern â€œsmart officeâ€ locations providing agile & collaborative workspaces

Dynamic international working environment

Position Summary

As a Data & Analytics Specialist, you will collaborate with functions, business units, and factories to leverage data and drive new business insights. You will extract and transform data from multiple sources, combining them into the required datasets for analytics and visualization purposes. You will provide technical expertise to the team and Swiss market functions on data analytics topics. Additionally, you will lead our product information activities and developments, ensuring quality and seamless data transmission to our customers.

We offer a dynamic, inclusive, and international working environment with many opportunities across different companies, functions, and regions. Donâ€™t miss the opportunity to join us and work with different teams in an agile and diverse context.

A Day in the Life of a Data & Analytics Specialist


Collaborate and communicate with teams to identify their needs, coordinate and implement impactful solutions that support business ambitions.
Extract, transform, and integrate data from diverse sources to create comprehensive datasets for analysis and visualization.
Ensure product information accuracy by assessing and monitoring data in source systems for publication in the Global Data Synchronization Network (GDSN), adhering to the latest GS1 standards for quality and timeliness.
Act as lead for product information projects within NestlÃ© Switzerland, facilitating communication and implementation of changes across the organization.
Facilitate a network of digital connected champions in factories to ensure data best practices, processes and solutions are implemented and efficient.


What Will Make You Successful


Bachelor or Masterâ€™s level degree in Computer Science, Engineering and 4 years of working experience in manipulating data (with exposure to Cloud solutions)
Willingness to challenge well-established processes and routines
Tech savvy with a curious mindset, good listening skills and business understanding
Experience in analytics activities in cross-functional and global organization
Experience with Office 365 Power Platform
Experience with Power BI, Power Query and Dax is a must
Experience in working with SAP, ETL/analytics solutions, data-as-a-service platforms (Azure & Snowflake is a plus)
Knowledge of SQL and Python
Experience with Robotics Process Automation is a plus
Good analytical skills and ability to work within cross-functional and remote teams
Fluent in English, working proficiency in French, German is an asset


At NestlÃ©, we want to help shape a better and healthier world, inspire people to live healthier lives and deliver impact at a scale and pace that makes a difference. We do this by fostering a diverse, friendly, supportive, and collaborative environment, that creates positive disruption, embraces innovation, and empowers people and teams to win.

We aim to hire friendly, respectful, inspiring people who care about the peopleâ€™s lives that we touch every single day.

Be a force for good. Join NestlÃ© and visit us on www.nestle.com.

#NestleCareerSwitzerland

Title: Banking - Data Analyst
Description:
AtÂ FORFIRM, we are looking for an experienced and motivatedÂ Senior Data AnalystÂ to join our lively international team and work on projects for Europe's leading brands!




Responsibility

Implementation and monitoring of data to ensure integrity and accuracy.
Development and maintenance of data quality reports.
Design of logical and conceptual data models to meet business requirements.
Collaboration with data architects and developers.
Analysis of large datasets to identify trends and patterns
Collaborate on strategic data projects for BANK clients and serve as the primary contact for data preparation.
Take the lead in overseeing various technical reporting areas, including responsibility for enhancing the CRM data mart, data modeling, data governance and compliance reporting, and conceptualizing and implementing financial accounting reporting

Several years of professional experience in the field of banking / financial services in the field of DWH / reporting
Expert in PL / SQL
Phyton script language experience
Expert in Power BI or similar BI tools
Organizational and conceptual skills as well as a structured and independent way of working
High service orientation and quality awareness in a very dynamic environment

Title: Data Analysis Team Lead
Description:
Main

Leading the Supervisory Instruments and Fundamentals of Data-Based Supervision
Expansion and optimization of the toolbox for data analysis and reporting
Further development of the methodology
Establish governance and centralise analysis and reporting to improve supervision
Governance of the Data Innovation Lab, using machine learning methods
Coordination of the provision of data as well as the use and development of processing tools




Profile

Master's degree in data science, mathematics or a science with a tradition in the use of data
At least 5 years of experience at a bank, insurance company or other financial institution
Experience in processing and analysing data as well as in preparing and reporting results
Knowledge of statistical methods and machine learning methodologies, as well as databases
Strong analytical and communication skills, high judgement and assertiveness
Impeccable written and oral expression in German (C2)

  • Leading the Supervisory Instruments and Fundamentals of Data-Based Supervision
  • Expansion and optimization of the toolbox for data analysis and reporting
  • Further development of the methodology
  • Establish governance and centralise analysis and reporting to improve supervision
  • Governance of the Data Innovation Lab, using machine learning methods
  • Coordination of the provision of data as well as the use and development of processing tools

  • At least 5 years of experience at a bank, insurance company or other financial institution

  • Knowledge of statistical methods and machine learning methodologies, as well as databases
  • Strong analytical and communication skills, high judgement and assertiveness

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company:

Our client, a NASDAQ-listed firm in Luzern, seeks a Business Data Analyst with 2-3 years of experience. They are looking for an individual who collects requirements, owns projects, comprehends business needs, and contributes to developing solutions that propel the business ahead.




About the Role:

Collaborate with business teams to understand their needs and translate them into requirements. Analyse business processes and identify opportunities for improvement. Act as a bridge between business and technical teams. Support project delivery from requirements gathering to implementation. Prepare reports and presentations to communicate insights and recommendations.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with business teams to understand their needs and translate them into requirements.
Analyse business processes and identify opportunities for improvement.
Act as a bridge between business and technical teams.
Support project delivery from requirements gathering to implementation.
Prepare reports and presentations to communicate insights and recommendations.




Qualifications:

2-3 years of business analysis experience.




Required Skills:

Passion for understanding business needs and turning them into solutions.
Ability to take ownership and push projects forward.
Problem-solving mindset with strong attention to detail.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Fluency in English.




Location:

Based in or near Luzern, or willing to relocate.




Equal Opportunity Statement:

Ready to grow your career in a global company? Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst (Single project)
Description:
Position: Data analyst

Location: Remote (Switzerland)

Reporting to: Research Director

Team: Global Team

Position type: Consultancy - single project




About our common home

Our Common Home is an organization dedicated to fostering widespread civic engagement to develop climate change solutions. We specifically focus on empowering individuals with traditional valuesâ€”those deeply connected to their communities, traditions, families, and nationsâ€”who have been left out of the conversation.

We build partnerships with and support civic organizations, believing that locally rooted civic associations are vital for building stable and successful climate change solutions and preserving natural inheritance.

Our mission is to reach a political consensus on the need to tackle climate change and empower everyone across society to work together in exploring and building solutions.

Research and empirical evidence are at the foundation of our strategy, campaigns, and decisions. We conduct social research through qualitative and quantitative methods to guide and back our work, from audience segmentation studies to opinion polls on specific issues, and also for monitoring and evaluation purposes. We are seeking a Data Analyst (consultant) to support our segmentation research through cluster analysis.




Overview

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst (Consultant) to support an audience segmentation study through rigorous cluster analysis. This is a consultancy-based role focused on deliverables, requiring expertise in clustering techniques, data analysis and visualisation. The ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting extensive data exploration, generating crosstabs, performing cluster analysis, developing archetypes, and producing intermediary and final datasets for joint evaluation and final visualisation of results. The analyst will collaborate closely with campaigners and strategists to understand their needs and offer tailored solutions for data analysis and visualisation.







Scope of work

Collaboration and planning

Work with campaigners, strategists and other research members to develop analysis plan tailored to their needs
Maintain regular communication and collaboration, including in-person sessions at key project stages.
Develop and oversee a structured project timeline, ensuring all deliverables are completed on time.

Advise on data collection

Provide input into questionnaire design to ensure data collection facilitates high-quality cluster analysis.

Exploratory data analysis

Conduct comprehensive exploratory data analysis, including:
Examination of frequencies
Common-sense segmentation
Correlation analysis
Processing and creation of new variables and indexes

Cluster analysis and segmentation profiling

Conduct rigorous cluster analysis to identify distinct population segments that align with campaigners' and strategists' needs.
Execute a minimum of three iterative rounds, presenting multiple solutions at each stage, with a commitment to refining until an optimal solution is achieved.
Perform detailed profiling of identified segments.
Lead the identification of "golden questions" for efficient segment classification.
Develop automated classification tools to facilitate future segmentation identification.

Visualisation, interpretation and reporting

Lead data interpretation, extracting actionable insights relevant to the organization.
Present segmentation findings in a clear, accessible manner for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Develop high-quality visualizations (e.g., graphs, charts, and dashboards) to enhance understanding of segmentation insights - including individual segment characteristics and comparatives across segments
Transform identified segments into detailed archetypes and personas to aid strategists and campaigners in practical application.




Deliverables

A structured workplan and project timeline, outlining key phases, deliverables, and meetings
Methodological document detailing the analysis process.
Contributions to sampling and questionnaire design:
Recommendations and feedback on questionnaire drafts.
Recommendations for sampling design through joint sessions with team members.




Exploratory analysis:

Analysis plan
Crosstabs (with agreed variables, including newly created or recoded variables)
Report or document with exploratory analysis results.
Presentation debriefing with team on results
Raw dataset incorporating new variables developed through preliminary analysis (.sav and excel formats) and adjusted codebook




Cluster analysis:

A minimum of three rounds of iterations, with a commitment to optimal solution. In the first iteration, at least three proposed solutions. In subsequent iterations: at least two proposed solutions per round.
For each round and solution:
Dataset comparing segments across defined variables.
Document with comparative assessment of solutions, including strengths and weaknesses
A session with the team to discuss results.




For final solution:

Dataset comparing segments across defined variables.
Final structured report incorporating insights to support practical application.
High-quality visual representation of segmentation findings, including charts and graphs for individual segments and cross-segment comparisons
Two rounds of feedback incorporated into the final report.
Presentation session for final report discussion.
Raw data set incorporating segment identifier (.sav and excel formats) and adjusted codebook




Golden questions and classification tool:

Three subsets of golden questions (long to short).
Guidelines for future use.
Accuracy rates for each subset.
Automated classification tool for each subset.




Deliverables will be provided progressively throughout the project. At the end of the project the consultant should deliver all final deliverables in an organised folder, accompanied by a metadata document describing each deliverable for reference and ease of use.




Core skills & qualifications

5+ years of experience in data analysis within NGOs, social impact sectors, or polling agencies.
Proven experience in data analysis
Proficiency in cluster analysis and audience segmentation methodologies - familiarity with multiple clustering approaches
Experience with GIS mapping or spatial data analysis is a plus.
Proficiency in open-source analysis tools such as R, SPSS, and Python.
Knowledge of sampling design and questionnaire development for optimized data collection and analysis
Strong data visualization skills
Excellent ability to communicate technical findings to non-technical audiences.
Ability to understand and resolve practical needs through data analysis and solutions
Experience working with multilingual data
Experience handling social research datasets.
Interest and experience in politics, social psychology, and/or climate change.
Self-motivated, highly organized, and capable of working independently and collaboratively.
Strong problem-solving skills, adaptability, and ability to handle multiple deadlines and projects
Experience working in a multi-stakeholder environment is an advantage.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (knowledge of French, German, Italian is a plus)




Why Join Us?

We work on an important challenge and offer a unique opportunity to develop an institution and leave a legacy with your work. Our style of work offered good work-life balance and freedom in the work schedule. Our pay is very competitive for the sector.




Apply for the role!

We ask interested candidates to submit:

CV
Cover Letter â€“ Explaining how your previous experience aligns with this role, and providing contextual background on the materials you submit (see below)
Example of analysis communication â€“ Presentation of an analysis you've conducted that demonstrates how insights were communicated to non-technical audience.
Segmentation Exercise â€“ An example of a segmentation analysis youâ€™ve worked on, including: the methodology used, key findings, supporting materials used for stakeholder communication (e.g., visualisations, graphs).

You may redact or anonymize sensitive information as needed.

  • Work with campaigners, strategists and other research members to develop analysis plan tailored to their needs
  • Maintain regular communication and collaboration, including in-person sessions at key project stages.
  • Develop and oversee a structured project timeline, ensuring all deliverables are completed on time.

Advise on data collection

  • Provide input into questionnaire design to ensure data collection facilitates high-quality cluster analysis.

Exploratory data analysis

  • Conduct comprehensive exploratory data analysis, including:
  • Examination of frequencies
  • Common-sense segmentation
  • Correlation analysis
  • Processing and creation of new variables and indexes

Cluster analysis and segmentation profiling

  • Conduct rigorous cluster analysis to identify distinct population segments that align with campaigners' and strategists' needs.
  • Execute a minimum of three iterative rounds, presenting multiple solutions at each stage, with a commitment to refining until an optimal solution is achieved.
  • Perform detailed profiling of identified segments.
  • Lead the identification of "golden questions" for efficient segment classification.
  • Develop automated classification tools to facilitate future segmentation identification.

Visualisation, interpretation and reporting

  • Lead data interpretation, extracting actionable insights relevant to the organization.
  • Present segmentation findings in a clear, accessible manner for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Develop high-quality visualizations (e.g., graphs, charts, and dashboards) to enhance understanding of segmentation insights - including individual segment characteristics and comparatives across segments
  • Transform identified segments into detailed archetypes and personas to aid strategists and campaigners in practical application.


Deliverables

  • A structured workplan and project timeline, outlining key phases, deliverables, and meetings
  • Methodological document detailing the analysis process.
  • Contributions to sampling and questionnaire design:
  • Recommendations and feedback on questionnaire drafts.
  • Recommendations for sampling design through joint sessions with team members.


Exploratory analysis:

  • Analysis plan
  • Crosstabs (with agreed variables, including newly created or recoded variables)
  • Report or document with exploratory analysis results.
  • Presentation debriefing with team on results
  • Raw dataset incorporating new variables developed through preliminary analysis (.sav and excel formats) and adjusted codebook


Cluster analysis:

  • A minimum of three rounds of iterations, with a commitment to optimal solution. In the first iteration, at least three proposed solutions. In subsequent iterations: at least two proposed solutions per round.
  • For each round and solution:
  • Dataset comparing segments across defined variables.
  • Document with comparative assessment of solutions, including strengths and weaknesses
  • A session with the team to discuss results.


For final solution:

  • Dataset comparing segments across defined variables.
  • Final structured report incorporating insights to support practical application.
  • High-quality visual representation of segmentation findings, including charts and graphs for individual segments and cross-segment comparisons
  • Two rounds of feedback incorporated into the final report.
  • Presentation session for final report discussion.
  • Raw data set incorporating segment identifier (.sav and excel formats) and adjusted codebook


Golden questions and classification tool:

  • Three subsets of golden questions (long to short).
  • Guidelines for future use.
  • Accuracy rates for each subset.
  • Automated classification tool for each subset.


Deliverables will be provided progressively throughout the project. At the end of the project the consultant should deliver all final deliverables in an organised folder, accompanied by a metadata document describing each deliverable for reference and ease of use.


Core skills & qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis within NGOs, social impact sectors, or polling agencies.
  • Proven experience in data analysis
  • Proficiency in cluster analysis and audience segmentation methodologies - familiarity with multiple clustering approaches
  • Experience with GIS mapping or spatial data analysis is a plus.
  • Proficiency in open-source analysis tools such as R, SPSS, and Python.
  • Knowledge of sampling design and questionnaire development for optimized data collection and analysis
  • Strong data visualization skills
  • Excellent ability to communicate technical findings to non-technical audiences.
  • Ability to understand and resolve practical needs through data analysis and solutions
  • Experience working with multilingual data
  • Experience handling social research datasets.
  • Interest and experience in politics, social psychology, and/or climate change.
  • Self-motivated, highly organized, and capable of working independently and collaboratively.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, adaptability, and ability to handle multiple deadlines and projects
  • Experience working in a multi-stakeholder environment is an advantage.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (knowledge of French, German, Italian is a plus)


Why Join Us?

We work on an important challenge and offer a unique opportunity to develop an institution and leave a legacy with your work. Our style of work offered good work-life balance and freedom in the work schedule. Our pay is very competitive for the sector.


Apply for the role!

We ask interested candidates to submit:

  • CV
  • Cover Letter â€“ Explaining how your previous experience aligns with this role, and providing contextual background on the materials you submit (see below)
  • Example of analysis communication â€“ Presentation of an analysis you've conducted that demonstrates how insights were communicated to non-technical audience.
  • Segmentation Exercise â€“ An example of a segmentation analysis youâ€™ve worked on, including: the methodology used, key findings, supporting materials used for stakeholder communication (e.g., visualisations, graphs).

You may redact or anonymize sensitive information as needed.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Business Unit Printing & Converting (BUPC) is looking for a Data Analyst.

Your main mission will be to translate data into valuable information and actionable recommendations for the business. This global position will be a key enabler for the BU in the achievement of our 2025 profitability.

You will be a key member of the BUPC Finance team with the role to manage and enhance our reporting capabilities while working closely with the Data Engineering team. This role involves gathering business requirements, developing insightful reports, and ensuring data accuracy and consistency across various dashboards. The ideal candidate will be proficient in analytics tools and have a deep understanding of business needs.

The BU Printing & Converting includes 11 Manufacturing sites in a context of a new ERP harmonization across all entities, and covers the following main streams Finance & Controlling, Operations, Sales & Marketing, R&D.


Report Development:
Design, develop, reports and dashboards
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability
Translate complex data into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Work closely with business teams to understand reporting requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Plan data source acquisition ahead with data engineers to deliver reports in a timely manner
Propose and maintain UX / UI best practices
Continuous Improvement & Documentation:
Document reporting processes, methodologies, and data definitions.
Recommend improvements to reporting tools and workflows to enhance efficiency.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in analytics and visualization.
Data Quality & Validation:
Identify and escalate data inconsistencies or anomalies to the data engineering team.
Support the Finance teamâ€™s evolution from basic reporting to new state of the art business intelligence tools
Accompany users to change
Process changes and corrective maintenance
Support IT Data & Analytics operating model
Create Data Analytics key usersâ€™ community within the BU
You have a Bachelor Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
Excellent level of English (French is a plus)
Innovative spirit and interest in company processes
Solution oriented mindset
Drive to continuously improve your area
High sense of responsibility and independent working practice, showing initiative and high level of reliability
Great data visualization skills by presenting analytical findings in a clear and concise manner
Adaptable to work to both technical and non-technical audiences
Team player with good communication skills


For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the worldâ€™s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, letâ€™s shape the future of the packaging world.

The production site of Mex, near Lausanne in Switzerland, is also the headquarters of the Bobst Group. It is the most important site, employing approx. 1500 passionate people.

It also trains each year roughly 200 apprentices. The site offers an idyllic work environment. In the countryside and close to major highways, it is also well served by public transport. It offers many amenities, such as a corporate restaurant, sports fields, a fitness and a nursery. The facilities have been recently renovated and represent a model for sustainable development.


3+ years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and visualization.
Proficiency in BI tools such as TableauÂ® (certification), Power BI, and Excel.
Knowledge of SAP HANA, Anaplan / OneStream is a plus
Experience working with large datasets and data warehouses.

Title: Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
Company Description

Vialto Partners is a market leader in global mobility services. Our purpose is to â€˜Connect the worldâ€™. We are unique and the only stand-alone global mobility business. This presents a rare opportunity for our clients, stakeholders and colleagues.

Our teams help companies streamline and effectively manage their global mobility programs in a cost-efficient and compliant manner. Our services focus on providing cross-border compliance and risk assessment for tax, immigration, business travel, rewards and compensation, and remote work.

Working at Vialto Partners is about getting the chance to be part of a global and dynamic team. Globally, Vialto Partners has over 6,500 staff worldwide and continues to grow. You will work with clients from a range of industries and different geographical locations. We believe in connecting the world and supporting our colleagues to do the same in their careers by undertaking assignments and opportunities globally that broaden their skills and ultimately benefit our clients.

Vialto is unstoppable when we work together in a culture of belonging, where everyone can thrive. We encourage employees to bring their true selves and share their unique talents and expertise to positively impact the communities we serve.

To learn more about what we do, tune in to our podcast On the Move to hear expert insights on issues affecting global mobility, and read about the latest news in the industry. You can also follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram .

Job Description Summary

The Global Office of Transformation at Vialto Partners has the mission to continuously optimize our delivery model and business processes, leveraging our people, technology and scale as a global enterprise. We are obsessed with driving value for our clients, assignees and employees.

Your pivotal role revolves around applying your expertise in data interpretation & manipulation to transform complex datasets into actionable insights. You will take the lead in automating routine tasks, deploying scalable tools across the organization, and enabling the organization to make faster, more informed decisions, all while driving growth and innovation.

Job Description

Data Analysis


Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights for business decisions in the form of dashboards & business intelligence products
Utilize statistical tools and software to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven strategies
Assist in optimizing business operations through data analysis
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across reports and analyses
Stay up to date with the latest trends and best practices in data analytics


Self-service Automation


Design, develop, and maintain self-service automation solutions that allow users to independently manage tasks and access data with minimal manual intervention
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify automation opportunities that improve user experience and operational workflows
Create user-friendly interfaces for automation tools, ensuring accessibility and ease of use for non-technical users
Implement automation solutions that integrate with various applications
Monitor and troubleshoot the performance of self-service automation tools, ensuring high availability and minimal disruptions
Develop training materials & documentation to empower users to take full advantage of self-service tools
Continuously analyze automation processes and feedback to improve functionality and user satisfaction
Stay updated with the latest automation technologies and best practices to continuously enhance service offerings


Change Management & Collaboration


Lead change management initiatives for the rollout of self-service automation tools and new data analytics capabilities, ensuring smooth transitions and adoption across teams
Collaborate closely with the Technology function and stakeholders in Client Service teams to align automation efforts with organizational goals and ensure tools meet business needs
Support ongoing communication and training efforts to encourage self-service adoption and guide users through any process changes


Qualifications & Skills


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
>5 years of proven experience in transforming operational and client-facing processes through data manipulation and insights
>5 years of proven experience in developing and implementing automation solutions, particularly self-service tools
Strong understanding of automation platforms and scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Power Automate or similar)
Highly proficient with tools such as Power BI, Power Apps, and Google Apps Script or Web Apps. Certification in these areas would be preferable
Knowledge of data-wrangling tools e.g. Alteryx is useful but not a must-have
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to build effective solutions
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users
Experience working with cross-functional teams to drive automation projects and improve workflows


Additional Information


We are an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate based on any legally protected status.


Please note, AI is used as part of the application process.

Company Description

Vialto Partners is a market leader in global mobility services. Our purpose is to â€˜Connect the worldâ€™. We are unique and the only stand-alone global mobility business. This presents a rare opportunity for our clients, stakeholders and colleagues.

Our teams help companies streamline and effectively manage their global mobility programs in a cost-efficient and compliant manner. Our services focus on providing cross-border compliance and risk assessment for tax, immigration, business travel, rewards and compensation, and remote work.

Working at Vialto Partners is about getting the chance to be part of a global and dynamic team. Globally, Vialto Partners has over 6,500 staff worldwide and continues to grow. You will work with clients from a range of industries and different geographical locations. We believe in connecting the world and supporting our colleagues to do the same in their careers by undertaking assignments and opportunities globally that broaden their skills and ultimately benefit our clients.

Vialto is unstoppable when we work together in a culture of belonging, where everyone can thrive. We encourage employees to bring their true selves and share their unique talents and expertise to positively impact the communities we serve.

To learn more about what we do, tune in to our podcast On the Move to hear expert insights on issues affecting global mobility, and read about the latest news in the industry. You can also follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram .

Title: Power quantitative analyst
Description:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies is targeting to build a portfolio of 100 GW of renewables by 2030 and to become one of the main player in renewables worldwide. This will be achieved through many investment projects (2-4 b$/year). Trading Power will contribute to this ambition by managing financial and physical power and risks of the renewables portfolio on open markets. TEM (Trading Energy Management) performance team aims at supporting TEM in creating a profitable and sustainable portfolio by providing analyses of the profitability and risks of its different businesses (PPA portfolio, short term optimisation, etcâ€¦).

As Power Quantitative Analyst, you will develop models to support risk analyses, fundamental modelling, hedging strategies and investment decisions and make recommendation to Structured Portfolio traders and senior management. This will require dealing with complex technical and theoretical problems requiring quantitative approaches.

ActivitÃ©s

What you will do:

As a Power Quantitative Analyst your main responsibilities will be the following:


Specify, design & implement mathematical models to handle pricing issues & risk assessment of a portfolio of renewables assets and backtest & optimise models performance.
Run regular risk analysis of the portfolio, analyse hedging strategies and portfolio effect, and make recommendation to traders and senior management.
Work closely with structured portfolio and short term traders to support them in specific risk & pricing analysis
Manage IT-related questions (deployment, QA) directly with IT and Trading Systems team (Python / AWS / TFS) and support Trading support function (MO, operations â€¦) with the takeover of tools developed by the team
Develop and maintain an understanding of Trading Power desks businesses and stay up to date regarding their positions and products.
Ensure support to other TGP and GRP teams on quant-related issues that may arise on their regular activity.



Profil du candidat


You hold a Masterâ€™s degree in Economics, Mathematics or Engineering
You have a first experience in a Power Trading environment
Strong modelling and analytical skills with strong attention to detail with first experience in quantitative modelling.
Basic knowledge of European and US energy markets
Programming skills (Python/ SQL/R/) and/or visualization frameworks (PowerBI/Streamlit,.) will be appreciated
Ability to work under pressure, rigor, proactivity and creativity
Good communication skills, ability to explain complex issues and present them in a clear and neat manner.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employeesâ€™ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Informations supplÃ©mentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversitÃ©, promeut le dÃ©veloppement individuel et offre des opportunitÃ©s d'emploi Ã©gales Ã  tous les candidats.
